Headlines: Estrogen Replacement May Negate the Benefits of Growth Hormone
Teaser: In a preliminary study, researchers have found evidence that boosting production of growth hormone can reduce body fat and help maintain levels of functioning in elderly men and women.

Headlines: Risedronate
Teaser: Bisphosphonates are pyrophosphate analogues which, originally used as antiscaling agents, have been available for general use in the treatment of various bone diseases since the 1980s.

Headlines: Beta-Blockers May Be Underused
Teaser: No increase in depression risk was seen, but there was a small risk of fatigue and sexual dysfunction.

Headlines: Identifying Significant Preventable Adverse Drug Events
Teaser: The widely recognized Institute of Medicine (IOM) report on patient safety has challenged medical facilities to systematically investigate and reduce medical errors.

Headlines: Food and Drug Administration Approvals, January 2003
Teaser: Biologics gain new approval with adalimumab, a novel monoclonal antibody for rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Medication Errors That Involved Drug Allergies at a Hospital
Teaser: Allergies to drugs can pose a challenge to achieving optimal drug therapy.

Headlines: Nature of Preventable Adverse Drug Events in Hospitals
Teaser: An Institute of Medicine (IOM) report on patient safety found that, "although there is still much to learn about the types of errors committed in health care and why they occur, enough is known today to recognize that a serious concern exists for patients."

Headlines: Recommended and Actual Lepirudin Doses in Patients With Renal
Teaser: Immune-mediated heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT), also known as HIT type II, is a potentially serious adverse effect of heparin therapy.

Headlines: Desensitization to a Sulfa Drug in an Immunocompetent Patient
Teaser: Should a physician attempt desensitization to a sulfa drug in an immunocompetent patient when an infectious disease specialist requests this for cellulitis?

Headlines: Treatment of Drug Allergy With Adrenaline?
Teaser: I have read in a paper that adrenaline should be the drug of first choice in the case of bee-sting allergy, even if the patient has only urticaria. Do you advise the same for drug allergy?

Headlines: Discontinuation and Reinstitution of Medications During the
Teaser: The issues regarding the discontinuation and reinstitution of long-term therapies, including cardiovascular agents,anticoagulants and antiplatelet agents, central nervous system agents, and herbal m

Headlines: Prevention and Treatment of Oropharyngeal Mucositis
Teaser: Oropharyngeal mucositis may be a distressing side effect of chemotherapy and irradiation. This comprehensive review offers recommendations to reduce symptoms and improve functioning.

Headlines: Meperidine is Alive and Well in the New Millennium
Teaser: A classic case of normeperidine toxicity, and to present institution-specific data on meperidine usage patterns and the frequency of adverse drug reactions.

Headlines: A Meta-Analysis of Botulinum Toxin Type A Safety
Teaser: BTX-A therapy has an excellent safety and tolerability profile across a wide range of cosmetic and therapeuticuses.

Headlines: SAMe Bioavailability and Lack of Toxicity in Humans
Teaser: The risk of mania in vulnerable individuals remains a serious concern.

Headlines: Methamphetamine-Associated Shock With Intestinal Infarction
Teaser: This article reports an unusual case of methamphetamine-associated intestinal infarction.

Headlines: FDA Safety Labeling Changes: Vesanoid, Kaletra, Axid, Enbrel
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for tretinoin capsules (Vesanoid), lopinavir/ritonavir capsules and oral solution (Kaletra), nizatidine 75-mg tablets (Axid AR), and etanercept (Enbrel).

Headlines: Clozapine, Olanzapine May Increase Risk of Insulin Resistance
Teaser: A cross sectional study suggests that compared with risperidone, use of these drugs is associated with a significantly higher risk of developing insulin resistance.

Headlines: Isotretinoin May Decrease Depression in Adolescents With Acne
Teaser: Treatment of moderate-severe acne either with conservative therapy or with isotretinoin was associated with a decrease, not an increase, in depressive symptoms.

Headlines: Use of the Beers Criteria to Predict Adverse Drug Reactions
Teaser: Clinicians should be alert to the possibility of ADRs if a patient takes more than 5 drugs, has a history of ADRs, or exhibits poor compliance with prescribed drugs.

Headlines: Drug-Resistant Variants of HIV-1 in India
Teaser: In northern India, most treatment-naive patients had mixtures of wild-type and mutant HIV; 80% had zidovudine (codon 70) and 32% lamivudine (M184V/I) resistance mutations.

Headlines: Adverse Effects Associated With Extra Doses of Bupropion
Teaser: Patients should be educated about the risk of adverse effects if they take extra doses of bupropion, which happened in about 10% of the patients studied.

Headlines: Managing a Patient Who Develops Urticaria to Medication
Teaser: A 56-year-old patient recently requested help with urticaria that occurs with any medication. What are your suggestions?

Headlines: Using Methotrexate at a Dosage > 25 mg per Week for RA
Teaser: Is there any evidence to support the use of methotrexate for rheumatoid arthritis at a dosage of > 25 mg per week? Also, what about methotrexate combined with azathioprine?

Headlines: Seafood and Iodine: An Analysis of a Medical Myth
Teaser: There is a common misconception that individuals who are allergic to seafood react to the iodine that is in the seafood. The basis of this misconception is explored.

Headlines: Withdrawal Effects When Discontinuing Antipsychotic Medications
Teaser: I have encountered withdrawal effects when discontinuing ziprasidone HCI (Geodon), even with a very slow taper of the drug. I'm wondering whether others have noted this in their patients.

Headlines: Adverse Drug Reactions in United States Hospitals
Teaser: This study of 8 million patients hospitalized in 1998 identified high-risk diagnoses and drug classes that providers can target to minimize adverse drug reactions.

Headlines: Intranasal Corticosteroids for Over-the-Counter Use
Teaser: A position paper on the advisability of allowing intranasal corticosteroids to be sold over the counter.

Headlines: Selected ID Topics: May 2006
Teaser: Dr. John G. Bartlett reviews publications on the risk for gatifloxacin-associated dysglycemia, and a randomized clinical trial of human botulism immune globulin for the treatment of infant botulism.

Headlines: Adverse Drug Reactions
Teaser: From a study on ethnic differences in adverse drug reactions published in the May 2006 issue of BMJ.

Headlines: Antipsychotic Therapy for Childhood Schizophrenia
Teaser: Why would children and teens experience better treatment response from first-generation antipsychotics compared with second-generation antipsychotics?

Headlines: How Can Physicians Stay Current on Prescription Drugs?
Teaser: With so many new drugs entering the market and new studies uncovering potential drug interactions and contraindications, how can a physician stay on top of the growing mound of information?

Headlines: A 60-Year-Old Woman With New Seizures
Teaser: The patient arrives at the emergency room after having a seizure at home, then experiences another one while there. Can you figure out the cause?

Headlines: Antiepileptic Drugs May Impair Bone Growth in Children
Teaser: Children on antiepileptic drug therapy may need to undergo bone mineral density screening on a yearly basis and be monitored closely for fracture risk.

Headlines: Can Leukotriene Modifiers Benefit Severe Drug-Induced Skin Reactions?
Teaser: "What is the role of leukotriene modifiers (montelukast) in severe drug-induced skin reaction? I have used it in a case of Stevens-Johnson syndrome, with very good results."

Headlines: Recognizing and Managing Stimulant Complications
Teaser: Noncompliance rates for stimulants can reach as high as 65%, primarily because of side effects. How can you minimize adverse events to maximize adherence and effectiveness of treatment?

Headlines: Drug Insight: resistance to methotrexate and other DMARDS
Teaser: This article discusses the molecular mechanisms that might be involved in the development of resistance to DMARDS and strategies to overcome this phenomenon.

Headlines: Sensitivity to Bee Pollen in Allergic Individuals
Teaser: The number of patients using "natural supplements," such as bee pollen for various medical conditions, continues to rise, but how safe is this?

Source: Cancer Control: Journal of the Moffitt Cancer Center
Headlines: Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Elderly Patients with Lung Cancer
Teaser: Survival benefits associated with adjuvant therapy may be reduced in the elderly due to poor tolerance of and toxicities from chemotherapy.

Headlines: Does Combining Duloxetine and Amitriptyline Raise the Risk for Seizures?
Teaser: Each drug has an associated risk for seizures, but what about in combination?

Headlines: HIV STI Literature: Commentary by Dr. John G. Bartlett -- April 2007
Teaser: In this review and commentary: 2 different studies of treatment interruption vs continuous ART lead to apparently different outcomes. Are CD4 cell counts at the time of restarting the reason?

Headlines: CF Patient Death May be Linked to Colistimethate Inhalation Therapy
Teaser: Inhalation solution should be used immediately to reduce the risk for pulmonary toxicity, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Pharmacist-Run Clinic Minimizes Concerns About Teriparatide
Teaser: Although it carries a black-box warning, this drug is effective in treating osteoporosis, and safety issues can be addressed with pharmacist oversight.

Headlines: Dietary Supplements Require Greater Vigilance
Teaser: Healthcare workers are a key piece of the safety net, but many are unaware of the role they are expected to play.

Headlines: Treating Hot Flashes Induced by Tamoxifen
Teaser: Can venlafaxine be used to treat hot flashes that occur as a side effect of tamoxifen?

Headlines: Dangers of Sexual Enhancement Supplements
Teaser: Dietary supplements including sexual enhancement products are heavily promoted. Many American consumers assume this means the government has ruled them safe for use, but this is a common misconception

Headlines: Are Drug Interactions With Dietary Products Underreported?
Teaser: A survey of community pharmacists found a worrisome lack of knowledge about potential interactions and adverse events.

Headlines: Adverse Drug Events More Than Doubled Between 1998 and 2005
Teaser: Serious adverse drug events reported to the US Food and Drug Administration's Adverse Event Reporting System increased 4 times faster than did the total number of outpatient prescriptions during this period.

Headlines: Gout: Treatment Reaction to Allopurinol - - What Next?
Teaser: A patient with gout intolerant to NSAIDs and colchicine developed rash on treatment with allopurinol and sulfinpyrazone. Desensitization with allopurinol was not successful. Can anakinra be tried?

Headlines: Are Duloxetine's Side Effects Dose Related?
Teaser: A patient with depression and fibromyalgia pain experiences sleepiness, fatigue, and dizziness after her dosage of duloxetine is increased to 120 mg. Is this because of the higher dosage?

Headlines: Should Patients With Asthma Receive Beta-Blockers for Heart Problems?
Teaser: Given the risk for bronchospasm associated with beta-blockers, should patients with asthma be taking these medications?

Headlines: Adverse Drug Reactions and Pharmacogenomics: Recent Advances
Teaser: Although the advancement of pharmacogenetics into clinical practice has been slower than predicted, it definitely has a place in drug development and safety predictions.

Headlines: Do Antihistamines Relieve Drug-Induced Bone Pain?
Teaser: Anecdotal reports suggest that nonsedating antihistamines ease bone pain associated with granulocyte colony-stimulating factor drugs. Does evidence support this practice?

Headlines: Pharmacologic Treatment of ADHD: Driving Patients to Successful Outcomes
Teaser: More accurate diagnosis of ADHD and the development of new formulations of proven drugs, plus a new class of drugs, are transforming the clinical picture of ADHD in the United States.

Headlines: Heparin Recall
Teaser: Nine lots of the antithrombin have been recalled because of a higher-than-expected rate of allergic reactions.

Headlines: Readers Respond to "Integrative Medicine: Sorting Fact From Fiction"
Teaser: Two readers further discuss the issue of integrative medicine.

Headlines: Probenecid for Gout: A Personal View
Teaser: Arthur Kavanaugh, MD, presents his personal view on the use of probenecid for the treatment of gout.

Headlines: Adverse Event Reporting for Cancer Therapy Needs Revision
Teaser: The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events was developed to standardize language for reporting adverse events that occur in NCI-sponsored clinical trials, but it is unable to adequately code the subacute adverse events that occur with new targeted therapies.

Headlines: Respiratory Compromise, Death May Be Linked to Botulinum Toxin
Teaser: An ongoing FDA safety review of Botox, Botox Cosmetic (botulinum toxin type A), and Myobloc (botulinum toxin type B) has shown systemic adverse reactions resembling botulism.

Headlines: FDA Takes Action to Stop Marketing of Unapproved Colchicine Injection
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has received 50 reports of adverse events with colchicine injection, including 23 deaths, related to product use.

Headlines: Two Studies Describe Approaches Shown to Reduce Obstetrical Errors
Teaser: Yale teaching hospital cut its obstetrical error rate in half after implementing changes; a single change by a Pennsylvania hospital also showed improvement in patient safety.

Headlines: Natalizumab May Cause Significant Liver Injury
Teaser: Natalizumab (Tysabri) should be discontinued in patients with jaundice or other signs of liver injury.

Headlines: Antiepileptic Drugs Linked to Increased Risk for Suicidality
Teaser: Patients taking certain drugs for epilepsy or other indications should be carefully monitored for behavioral changes.

Headlines: Varenicline May Be Linked to Risk for Serious Symptoms
Teaser: Patients given varenicline should be monitored for strange thoughts/behaviors, depressed mood, and suicidality.

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Hormone replacement therapy may result in a higher risk for breast cancer, both hysterectomy and uterine artery embolization can help treat uterine fibroids, tendonitis may be a result of statin use, obese children have more surgical complications than children of a normal weight, a change in selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors in conjunction with cognitive behavioral therapy may be adequate t

Headlines: Asthma Medication Evaluated for Possible Link to Mood Changes,  Suicidality
Teaser: The FDA has issued a MedWatch Safety alert informing doctors and patients that it is investigating a possible link between use of montelukast and changes in mood and behavior as well as suicidality and suicide.

Headlines: More Heparin Recalls in Europe and US
Teaser: The latest countries to recall heparin products are France, Italy, and Denmark, and the affected material has been traced to four Chinese suppliers. Another US manufacturer has also recalled some heparin products.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant Identified
Teaser: The contaminant found in samples of heparin that had been linked to an increase in adverse reactions has now been identified as oversulfated chondroitin sulfate.

Headlines: Tiotropium Linked to Possible Increased Risk of Stroke
Teaser: On the basis of an ongoing safety review, MedWatch reports a possible increased risk of stroke with use of tiotropium.

Headlines: Serious Skin Reactions Reported With TNF-alpha Antagonists
Teaser: Safety reviews of infliximab, etanercept, and adalimumab identified rare cases of erythema multiforme, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, and other skin reactions.

Headlines: Cough Medicine Dosing Errors Linked to Patient Deaths
Teaser: Patients should not take hydrocodone plus chlorpheniramine extended-release suspension (Tussionex) more often or at higher doses than recommended.

Headlines: New HIV Drug Linked to Risk for Hepatitis
Teaser: Liver enzymes should be monitored during treatment with ritonavir-boosted darunavir.

Headlines: Diabetic Ulcer Gel Linked to Increased Cancer Deaths
Teaser: Healthcare professionals are advised to discuss risks and benefits of becaplermin gel (Regranex) with patients.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant
Teaser: The FDA is requesting all heparin manufacturers to test products for this contaminant. Increased rates of adverse reactions have now also been reported in Germany with heparin not made by Baxter or its supplier, Scientific Protein Laboratories.

Headlines: Early Rheumatoid Arthritis: The Potential Role for Biologic Therapy
Teaser: Three key questions concerning the use of biologic therapy in early rheumatoid arthritis are presented and discussed by Arthur Kavanaugh, MD.

Headlines: Part 2: Reader's and Authors' Responses to "Integrative Medicine"
Teaser: A reader and the authors discuss complementary and alternative medicine.

Headlines: Part 3: A Reader Responds to "Integrative Medicine"
Teaser: A reader writes favorably about the integration of Eastern and Western medicine.

Headlines: Antiviral Drug Labels Get Warnings for Neuropsychiatric Changes
Teaser: Patients with influenza should be closely monitored for signs of abnormal behavior during treatment with Tamiflu and possibly also Relenza.

Headlines: Black Box Warning Issued for Etanercept Regarding Infections
Teaser: A black box warning to be included on etanercept's prescribing information states that tuberculosis has been observed with TNF-blocking agents and that tuberculosis may be caused by reactivation of latent tuberculosis infection and by new infection.

Headlines: Study Data Link 2 NRTIs to Increased MI Risk
Teaser: The FDA recommends that healthcare professionals discuss potential risks and benefits of abacavir (Ziagen) and didanosine (Videx) therapy, including myocardial infarction, with HIV-infected patients.

Headlines: Heparin Contaminant Traced to China
Teaser: The FDA has also issued an import alert requiring all heparin products be tested for the contaminant.

Headlines: Transparency in Adverse Event Reporting Pleases Patients
Teaser: A new survey reveals that hospitalized patients are informed of less than half of all adverse events that they experience.

Headlines: "Jake Leg," Other Poisonings, Physicians as Canaries, and the FDA
Teaser: Emily Friedman, an independent health policy and ethics analyst, reminds us why doctors must be "canaries" and the FDA must act.

Headlines: Drug Safety Relies on YOU to Find and Report Adverse Reactions
Teaser: Judith K. Jones, MD, PhD, President & CEO, The Degge Group, Ltd., Arlington, Virginia, explains why and how to report adverse drug events.

Headlines: Anticholinergic Drugs May Increase Cognitive Decline
Teaser: A new study finds that use of drugs with anticholinergic activity is associated with a more rapid decline in cognitive performance.

Headlines: Enoxaparin Contaminant
Teaser: Some countries have recalled affected batches, although no increase in adverse reactions has been seen.

Headlines: Rotigotine Patch Recalled Due to Drug Crystallization
Teaser: Drug crystallization can hamper absorption; healthcare professionals are advised to begin down-titrating patients according to product guidelines and should not initiate rotigotine therapy in new patients.

Headlines: Rubber Chemical Found in Daptomycin Infusion Pumps
Teaser: Healthcare professionals are advised to avoid the use of daptomycin with ReadyMED elastomeric infusion pumps.

Headlines: Tegaserod Maleate Restricted to Emergency Use Only
Teaser: FDA must approve requests for tegaserod maleate and must authorize shipments from the manufacturer.

Headlines: Exubera Gets Lung Cancer Warning
Teaser: Cases occurred in prior smokers and are too few to establish a causal role for the product.

Headlines: FDA Backpedals on Echo-Contrast Labeling
Teaser: Warnings and contraindications imposed late last year have been softened after the agency heard from the medical community.

Headlines: AHA Recommendations on Cardiovascular Monitoring in ADHD and Heart Disease
Teaser: The AHA has recommended ECGs for children/adolescents being considered for, and in some cases, already receiving, stimulant agents for ADHD. What are the clinical implications of this recommendation?

Headlines: Etanercept Gets Black Box Warning for TB Risk
Teaser: Patients should be both screened for latent tuberculosis before initiation of etanercept therapy and monitored for infection during and after treatment.

Headlines: Transplant Drug Linked to Risk for Fetal Harm
Teaser: Women of childbearing age should be required to use 2 forms of birth control before, during, and after treatment with mycophenolate mofetil and mycophenolic acid.

Headlines: FDA Investigates Link Between TNF Blockers and Pediatric Cancer
Teaser: Thirty cases of cancer have been reported in children and young adults receiving tumor necrosis factor blockers for arthritis, Crohn's disease, and other conditions.

Headlines: Comparative Study of the Stability of Bimatoprost and Latanoprost
Teaser: The purpose of this study was to determine the degree of molecular degradation that occurs in bimatoprost and latanoprost in a patient-use setting.

Headlines: Probe of Erythropoiesis-Stimulating Agents
Teaser: The preliminary work suggests that erythropoietin might have an effect not only on red blood cells but on tumor blood vessels as well. It is a provocative hypothesis that is generating fervent debate.

Headlines: Five Deaths in the UK Related to Rimonabant
Teaser: But only one of these deaths was due to psychiatric disorders (suicide), which is the major concern with this drug. Sanofi-Aventis has stressed that no causal link between any of the deaths and rimonabant has been established.

Headlines: Diabetic Ulcer Gel Gets Black Box Warning
Teaser: An FDA safety review showed a 5-fold increased risk for cancer mortality in patients exposed to 3 or more tubes of becaplermin gel.

Headlines: fluoroquinolones
Teaser: What's behind the new FDA black box warnings for fluoroquinolones? Paul Auwaerter, MD, discusses the recent major labeling change in his videoblog.

Headlines: CellCept Labeling Changes Reflect PML Risk
Teaser: Healthcare providers should include progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in the differential diagnosis of immunosuppressed patients presenting with focal neurologic symptoms.

Headlines: Use of rhBMP in Cervical Fusion Linked to Serious Adverse Events
Teaser: Healthcare providers should use approved alternative treatments or enroll in approved clinical trials.

Headlines: Fluoroquinolones Earn Black Box Warning for Tendon-Related Adverse Effects
Teaser: The magnitude of reported adverse events related to fluoroquinolone use necessitates stronger warnings regarding the risk for tendonitis and tendon rupture.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Members Agree AEDs Pose Suicidality Risk, Nix Black Box
Teaser: Antiepileptic drugs pose an increased risk of suicidality, but the data do not warrant a black-box warning, advisory committee members told the FDA.

Headlines: Does Switching Statins Increase the Risk for Adverse Events?
Teaser: Patients on statin therapy sometimes must switch from one statin to another. Does that increase the risk of developing an adverse reaction?

Headlines: Herceptin Vials to Be Checked for Damage, FDA Warns
Teaser: Breakage and other damage may compromise sterility and pose infection risk to patient.

Headlines: Genetic Screening Recommended Before Abacavir HIV Therapy
Teaser: Screening for a particular allele can decrease the risk for abacavir hypersensitivity reactions by 60%.

Headlines: Local and National Legislation Banning Phthalates and BPA Considered
Teaser: A bill has been introduced to Congress to prohibit the use of bisphenol A in all food and drink containers; the Senate is considering expanding the proposed ban to include toys and other children's products.

Headlines: Osteonecrosis in Long-term Survivors of Cancer
Teaser: In this videoblog, Dr. Maurie Markman discusses findings from the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study, which highlight the importance of long-term studies.

Headlines: Does Use of Nicotine Replacement Therapy During Pregnancy Affect Outcomes?
Teaser: What are the characteristics of the women who are prescribed or recommended nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) during pregnancy? Is NRT safe for use during pregnancy?

Headlines: Antithrombotic and Thrombolytic Therapy: ACCP Guidelines in Perspective
Teaser: New evidence-based ACCP guidelines address prevention and management of thrombosis. Dr. Shorr discusses NEJM articles on this prevention during hip and knee replacement surgeries.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Deemed Safe and Effective, Despite Reports of Adverse Events
Teaser: Questions over the safety of the human papillomavirus vaccine have been raised by consumers, parents, healthcare professionals, and others. But having analyzed the available data, the CDC and FDA offer reassurance.

Headlines: FDA Releases List of Genomic Biomarkers Predictive of Drug Interactions
Teaser: Quarterly updates of the table by the US Food and Drug Administration should help keep clinicians and patients informed about potential drug response and risk for adverse reactions.

Headlines: Generic Fixed-Dose Combination of Tenofovir/Emtricitabine/Efavirenz in HIV
Teaser: The investigators studied the effectiveness and safety of a generic fixed-dose combination of tenofovir/emtricitabine/efavirenz among HIV-1-infected patients in Western India.

Headlines: Taxanes Increase Risk for Psychologic Symptoms
Teaser: Patients who receive taxane-based chemotherapy have delayed emotional recovery and a higher rate of probable clinical depression than patients on similar regimens without taxanes.

Headlines: New PML Cases Reported With Tysabri Monotherapy
Teaser: Natalizumab monotherapy is still believed to be safer than combination treatment with other immunomodulatory agents.

Headlines: Adverse Events in the Hospital Setting: How Safe Is Your Operating Room?
Teaser: Commentary on a study on in-hospital adverse events, published June 2008 in Quality and Safety in Health Care.

Headlines: Cialis, Viagra Labels to Note Amnesia
Teaser: Rare reports of transient global amnesia have been added to the Cialis and Viagra labels; the condition is already on the Levitra label.

Headlines: Effects of Sunitinib in Renal Cell Cancer Patients
Teaser: Researchers describe adverse dermatologic effects in the scrotal and inguinal areas in 5 of 40 patients taking sunitinib for renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: FDA Warns About Injection Site Reactions With Naltrexone
Teaser: Injectable, extended-release naltrexone, used for the treatment of alcohol dependence, has been linked to adverse injection-site reactions, some requiring surgery.

Headlines: Byetta Linked to Acute Pancreatitis
Teaser: Exenatide therapy has been linked to 6 new cases of hemorrhagic or necrotizing pancreatitis.

Headlines: Contrast Media Reactions Pose Serious Risk of Nephropathy
Teaser: Iodinated contrast media perform an important function in imaging, but they also can increase the risk for morbidity and mortality due to nephropathy.

Headlines: Can Pharmacists Improve the Accuracy of Medication Histories?
Teaser: Physicians may be missing important pieces of a patient's medication history at hospital admission.

Headlines: The Genetics of Statin-Induced Myopathy
Teaser: Dr. Eric Topol discusses the newly reported genetic basis for statin-induced myopathy in this videoblog.

Headlines: Patient Deaths Spark Stronger Warnings for TNF Blockers
Teaser: Patients should be monitored for signs and symptoms of fungal infection both during and after therapy.

Headlines: Rituxan Linked to Fatal PML Case
Teaser: Clinicians are advised to consider progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy in rituximab-treated patients presenting with new-onset neurologic manifestations.

Headlines: Phosphocol Linked to Risks for Malignancy and Radiation Injury
Teaser: Postmarketing cases of lymphocytic leukemia have been reported with intra-articular use; intraperintoneal use has been linked to local necrosis and fibrosis.

Headlines: Company, Investigator Disagree on Reporting of Epoetin Alfa Trial
Teaser: Ortho Biotech announced that preliminary data from a trial of epoetin alfa in stroke patients show higher mortality among treated patients than those on placebo and that it had informed the FDA. The lead investigator of the trial, though, says the statement is inaccurate as it stands and that the increase in mortality was limited to patients who received both tissue plasminogen activator and epoet

Headlines: High-Dose Epogen/Procrit Linked to Deaths
Teaser: Adverse events in other epoetin-alfa clinical trials should be monitored to ensure that the potential benefits outweigh the risks to patients.

Headlines: Tarceva Linked to 2 Fatal Cases of Hepatotoxicity
Teaser: Patients with hepatic impairment should be closely monitored during treatment with erlotinib.

Headlines: Bupropion-induced Angioedema
Teaser: Cases of angioedema, a rare adverse effect of bupropion, have not been extensively described. What does this first published case report describing apparent bupropion-induced angioedema illustrate?

Headlines: 20 Drugs the FDA Is Watching
Teaser: The first new quarterly report identifies adverse drug effects that are under FDA investigation.

Headlines: Particulate Matter Found in Ammonul Injection
Teaser: Filters must be used during the admixture process because particulate matter may not be visible to the naked eye.

Headlines: Inhaled Anticholinergics in Patients With COPD
Teaser: Dr. Andrew Shorr discusses recent studies from JAMA and NEJM that focus on inhaled anticholinergics used in the treatment of COPD.

Headlines: Erythrocyte-Mediated Delivery of Dexamethasone in Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: Nearly 25% of patients with ulcerative colitis requiring steroids therapy become steroid-dependent after 1 year, and virtually all develop steroid-related adverse events. The authors investigate the efficacy and safety of dexamethasone 21-P encapsulated into erythrocytes.

Headlines: Rimonabant Suspended in Europe
Teaser: European regulators say rimonabant's benefits no longer outweigh its risks. Its manufacturer, however, says it remains committed to the drug and hopes to provide evidence to support its reevaluation in the future.

Headlines: Postmarketing Surveillance for Biologic Agents
Teaser: Biologics are a rapidly growing class of drugs, but many of their associated safety problems are not identified until after receiving approval from regulatory agencies.

Headlines: Boxed Warning Highlights Risk for Infection With Raptiva
Teaser: Postmarketing reports indicate an increased risk for opportunistic infections in patients receiving efalizumab injection.

Headlines: Preliminary Data Suggest Spiriva Not Linked to Increased Stroke Risk
Teaser: Findings contradict recently published findings that tiotropium bromide increases the risk for mortality and/or cardiovascular events.

Headlines: Bevacizumab Significantly Increases VTE Risk
Teaser: The risk of venous thromboembolism was increased by 33%, compared with controls, concludes a new meta-analysis of 15 cancer trials.

Headlines: Lower Risk for Gallbladder Disease With Transdermal Hormone Therapy
Teaser: Oral hormone therapy increases women's risk of gallbladder hospitalizations and procedures. What are the risks and benefits of transdermal hormone therapy?

Headlines: Drug Interactions in Patient Causes Simvastatin-Induced Rhabdomyolysis
Teaser: This case report describes a patient with a 12-year history of simvastatin use who presented with rhabdomyolysis.

Headlines: Panel: Toughen Dermal Filler Warnings
Teaser: An FDA panel wants stronger warning labels on dermal fillers like Restylane and Juvederm injected into the face for wrinkles.

Headlines: More Research Urgently Needed on Off-Label Use of 14 Drugs
Teaser: A quantitative analysis identified particular concerns regarding safety of off-label use of antipsychotic and antidepressant drugs.

Headlines: Statin Adverse Effects
Teaser: Adverse effects from statins are not rare and may signal a mitochondrial vulnerability.

Headlines: Possible Dose-Side Effect Relationship of Antipsychotic Drugs
Teaser: What adverse events on motor function are a cause for concern with antipsychotic drugs?

Headlines: Higher Mortality, CHF With Rosiglitazone
Teaser: A retrospective analysis of Medicare beneficiaries found all-cause mortality to be increased by 15% in patients taking rosiglitazone, while congestive heart failure hospitalizations were 13% higher. Stroke and MI, however, were no different between the treatment groups.

Headlines: NAION With PDE-5 Inhibitors for Erectile Dysfunction
Teaser: This article reviews the visual side effects of PDE-5 inhibitors, and examines evidence concerning the association of PDE-5 inhibitor use with nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION).

Headlines: FDA Investigates Genetic Link to Phenytoin Skin Reactions
Teaser: Clinicians should avoid the antiepileptic drugs phenytoin and fosphenytoin as alternatives to carbamazepine therapy in patients positive for the HLA-B*1502 allele.

Headlines: Five Generic Ethex Products Recalled Because of Overdose Risk
Teaser: Oversize tablets may contain up to double the amounts of the active ingredient.

Headlines: No Link Between Bisphosphonates and Atrial Fibrillation, FDA Says
Teaser: The agency is advising healthcare professionals not to alter their prescribing patterns for bisphosphonate therapy.

Headlines: Contraindications, Intramuscular to Subcutaneous Depo-Provera
Teaser: What should I consider before switching adolescent girls from IM Depo-Provera to the new subcutaneous preparation?

Headlines: Esomeprazole Prevents Aspirin-Induced Ulcers
Teaser: George Lundberg discusses how esomeprazole prevents aspirin-induced ulcers.

Headlines: Antipsychotics and Akathisia
Teaser: Dr. Nathan E. Lavid discusses the likelihood that certain antipsychotic medication induces akathisia.

Headlines: CDC Provides Details on Heparin Investigation
Teaser: A new paper tells the story of how the CDC, after identifying oversulfated chondroitin as the plausible culprit contaminant, linked products containing the contaminant to the clinical symptoms of patients treated across 21 facilities in 13 states.

Headlines: Panel Disputes FDA Finding on Antiepileptics and Risk for Suicide

Teaser: Combining therapies that target MEK and PI3K pathways has the potential to be more effective than either agent used alone.

Headlines: A Post-Stroke Hemorrhagic Rash
Teaser: What is the cause of a new rash in an elderly man who is taking anticoagulant drugs?

Headlines: FDA Adds Further Risk Information to Natalizumab Label
Teaser: The FDA identified a need to better define risk for progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy and increased risk from concomitant immunosuppressants.

Headlines: Spondyloarthropathies: Anti-tumor Necrosis Factor-alpha Agents
Teaser: How effective is switching between different anti-TNF agents in the treatment of spondyloarthropathies?

Headlines: High-Dose Escitalopram in Major Depressive Disorder
Teaser: The SSRI escitalopram is licensed for use at doses up to 20 mg, but some clinicians are using it at doses considerably higher than the recommended maximum. Is this dose safe--or beneficial?

Source: International Journal for Quality in Health Care
Headlines: Self-reported Medical, Medication and Laboratory Error
Teaser: How often are medical and medication errors self-reported?

Headlines: High-Dose Ketorolac Affects Adult Spinal Fusion
Teaser: Too much ketorolac may result in disunion in patients post surgery for spinal fusion.

Headlines: Refractory Topiramate-Induced Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: A 39-year-old man being treated with topiramate for migraine headaches presented to the ER with blurred vision, severe headache and eye pain.  What's the diagnosis?

Source: International Journal for Quality in Health Care
Headlines: Adverse Events Rates in Hospitals and Hospital Departments
Teaser: How are adverse events reported in hospitals, and how do they differ from department to department?

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics of Abacavir: Current Clinical Implications
Teaser: Dr. Daniel Kuritzkes reviews current data on the clinical benefit of HLA-B*5701 testing to prevent abacavir hypersensitivity reaction.

Headlines: FDA: Safety Issue With Investigational Merck Hepatitis Drug
Teaser: U.S. drug reviewers highlighted safety issues with an experimental Merck & Co hepatitis drug, including anemia and reports of psychiatric problems, in documents released on Monday.

Headlines: Adverse Device-Related Events Are Frequent in Children
Teaser: Adverse outcomes from the use of medical devices in children are frequent but underrecognized.

Headlines: Sulfonamides and Nitrofurantoins OK to Use During Pregnancy
Teaser: An opinion statement says that most antibiotics are safe to use during pregnancy and that pregnant women should not be denied appropriate treatment of infections.

Headlines: Inhaled Anticholinergics Linked to Acute Urinary Retention
Teaser: The product may be associated with an increased risk for necrotizing enterocolitis; healthcare professionals should stop administering the product to premature infants.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Use of SimplyThick in Premature Infants
Teaser: Results of this study have possible suggestions for long-term aspirin use in the prevention of chronic disease, as aspirin dose appears to be more important than aspirin duration.

Headlines: Daily Azithromycin Reduces Acute Exacerbations of COPD
Teaser: A systematic review suggests that antibiotic exposure prenatally or in early childhood may slightly increase the risk for childhood asthma.

Headlines: Antibiotics May Slightly Increase Risk for Childhood Asthma
Teaser: In men with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, use of short- and long-acting inhaled anticholinergic medications is associated with an increased risk for acute urinary retention.

Headlines: Absolute Risk for Femur Fracture Low With Bisphosphonates
Teaser: Although there is a high rate of bisphosphonate use among patients with atypical femur fractures, the absolute risk for such fractures is small enough to justify prescribing the drugs.

Headlines: Zoledronic Acid Linked With Seizures in Case Reports
Teaser: Use of zoledronic acid for osteoporosis may occasionally be associated with seizures, according to three case reports published online April 20th in the Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism.

Headlines: Correct Acetaminophen Dose Depends on Children's Weight
Teaser: Infant drug labels should spell out dose.

Headlines: Genetic Biomarkers May Predict Taxane-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: Several single-nucleotide polymorphisms associated with time to neuropathy in patients receiving paclitaxel therapy have been identified.

Source: Journal of the American Board of Family Medicine
Headlines: Teratogen Use in Women of Childbearing Potential
Teaser: Several commonly prescribed drugs have teratogenic potential, including ACE inhibitors, ARBs, and statins. How aware are physicians of the risks of these drugs to women of childbearing age?

Headlines: Use Caution When Prescribing Fluoroquinolones to Athletes
Teaser: New guidelines will help eliminate adverse events in active children and adults who are given fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

Headlines: Patient Report of Chemotherapy Adverse Effects
Teaser: If symptoms are not reported immediately, are they reported accurately?

Headlines: Does Long-term Corticosteroid Use Necessitate PCP Prophylaxis?
Teaser: Some patients use corticosteroids for prolonged periods of time. Are they at risk for pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP)?

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics of Irinotecan: Clinical Implications
Teaser: Dr. Maurie Markman reviews current data on the clinical benefit of UGT1A1*28 screening to prevent irinotecan-related neutropenia.

Headlines: Cannabis Gives Cancer Patients the Munchies (Go Figure)
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr reports on a study indicating that the active cannabis ingredient delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol improves appetite and sense of taste in cancer patients. Can it also improve caloric intake?

Headlines: Vaccine Critics Claim Court Paid for Autism Cases
Teaser: The study reports that 83 cases of vaccine-caused brain damage receiving federal compensation involved autism. Experts reply that shared symptoms do not make brain damage and autism identical.

Headlines: Thyroid Drug Linked to Fracture Risk in Older Adults
Teaser: Among adults 70 years and older, current thyroid treatment was associated with significantly increased fracture risk, with a strong dose-response relationship.

Headlines: Do PPIs Interact With Levothyroxine?
Teaser: Do patients taking a proton-pump inhibitor  and levothyroxine require close monitoring of thyroid-stimulating hormone?

Headlines: Electronic Postdischarge Chart Prevents Adverse Drug Events
Teaser: Hospitalized patients who are receiving high-risk medications such as warfarin, analgesics, or benzodiazepines benefit from having pharmacists involved in discharge planning.

Headlines: Drug Product Recall Due to Possible Penicillin Contamination
Teaser: Concerns over potential cross-contamination of nonpenicillin drug products with penicillin have resulted in a nationwide recall of multiple repackaged products.

Headlines: FDA Review Concludes: No Cancer Risk With ARBs
Teaser: An FDA review launched in the wake of a controversial 2010 meta-analysis has concluded that the drugs do not pose a cancer risk to patients. The FDA says it conducted a much larger, more comprehensive review of the data to reach its reassuring conclusions. Not everyone, however, is satisfied.

Headlines: Toxidromes: What Every Critical Care Nurse Should Know
Teaser: Critical care nurses need to be aware of toxidromes, a group of signs and symptoms and/or characteristic effects associated with exposure to a particular substance or class of substances.

Headlines: French Regulators Suspend Pioglitazone Citing Cancer Risk
Teaser: The decision to yank the drug was made after a study requested by the drug regulatory authority, AFSSAPS, confirmed a small increase in bladder cancer among patients treated with the diabetes drug.

Headlines: Long-Term Doxorubicin Linked to Secondary Oral Cancers
Teaser: Secondary cancers of the oral cavity appear to be associated with long-term treatment with pegylated liposomal doxorubicin in patients with recurrent ovarian cancer.

Headlines: New Criteria Define Inappropriate Meds in Older Inpatients
Teaser: STOPP criteria define potentially inappropriate medications and are significantly associated with avoidable adverse drug events leading to urgent hospitalization in older persons.

Headlines: Pioglitazone for 1 Year May Increase Risk of Bladder Cancer
Teaser: In the FDA's announcement today, the agency stated that information on the drug's label, as well as the patient medication guide, will be revised to include this new information.

Headlines: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients Overdosed With Cytarabine
Teaser: Patients being treated for acute myeloid leukemia receive up to 10 times more cytarabine than necessary, exposing them to excess toxicity but no added efficacy.

Headlines: Risperidone Recalled Due to Possible Contamination
Teaser: Manufacturers of the antipsychotic risperidone have initiated a voluntary recall involving 40,000 bottles of the drug due to possible contamination with a wood preservative.

Headlines: Study Raises Cancer-ARB Question Again
Teaser: In this latest study of diabetic patients treated with ARBs, candesartan was associated with a significant risk of cancer, while there was a trend toward an increased risk with telmisartan. The clinician who first sparked the ARB-cancer controversy says these new data should force the FDA to look again at patient-level data to assess the cancer risk with the drug class.

Headlines: Recall of Pain, Headache Meds Because of Label Mix-Up
Teaser: Patients who accidentally take a tablet containing butalbital could experience sedation, lightheadedness, dizziness, and nausea, according to the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: New Tylenol Recall Due to Musty Odor
Teaser: Johnson and Johnson recalls about 60,000 bottles of Tylenol Extra Strength Caplets.

Headlines: Simvastatin 80 mg: If You Can't Go Lower, Go Elsewhere
Teaser: Howard Weintraub is concerned that physicians will continue to prescribe this generic agent at this unsafe dose because of cost concerns and he offers an alternative.

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics of Carbamazepine: Clinical Implications
Teaser: Dr. Andrew Wilner reviews current data on the clinical benefit of HLA-B*1502 screening to avoid carbamazepine-related hypersensitivity.

Headlines: Newer Antiepileptic Drugs in Pregnancy
Teaser: An epidemiologic study provides data that may be helpful when counseling women of childbearing age who are taking newer antiepileptic drugs.

Headlines: Chemo Toxicity May Tip Scales in Advanced Hodgkin's Lymphoma
Teaser: Overall survival nearly evened out in a clinical trial comparing 2 chemotherapy regimens; adverse events might be a deciding factor in choosing one or the other.

Headlines: Etravirine Shows Fewer Neuropsychiatric AEs Than Efavirenz
Teaser: Compared with efavirenz, etravirine appears to be associated with fewer neuropsychiatric adverse events.

Headlines: Single Lot of Calcium Gluconate Injection Recalled
Teaser: American Regent is voluntarily recalling its calcium gluconate injection, USP, 10% 100 mL pharmacy bulk package, lot number 1006, because some vials may contain silicone particles.

Headlines: Benefits of Ovarian Suppression During Breast Cancer Chemo
Teaser: The rate of early menopause is significantly reduced, but any fertility benefit is unknown.

Headlines: New  FDA Watch List Has Drug Making Fifth Straight Appearance
Teaser: Several of the potential signals in 2010 of serious risks for dronedarone, an  antiarrhythmic, have been followed by label changes.

Headlines: Pediatric Collaborative May Reduce Adverse Drug Events
Teaser: A pediatric collaborative addressing systems of medication delivery was associated with lower rates of adverse drug events at participating institutions.

Headlines: Thyroid Effects of Generic, Brand-Name Amiodarone Similar
Teaser: The anti-arrhythmic drug amiodarone is linked with similar rates of thyroid effects whether patients take the brand-name drug or a generic, Canadian research shows.

Headlines: FDA Reminds Clinicians About Risks With Belatacept
Teaser: The manufacturer was required to inform clinicians and patients about the risk for posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder and progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy when the FDA okayed the kidney transplant drug.

Headlines: FDA Studying Link Between Bisphosphonates, Esophageal Cancer
Teaser: The agency continues to review studies that reach different conclusions on the possible association between esophageal cancer and the widely prescribed drugs for osteoporosis.

Headlines: Probiotics for Antibiotic-Associated Diarrhea?
Teaser: Do products containing live microorganisms really restore normal GI function?

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Vaccine Not Linked to Guillain-Barré Syndrome
Teaser: In a case-control study, the risk for Guillain-Barré syndrome was not increased after pandemic influenza vaccine, but the upper limit did not exclude a potential increase in risk up to 2.7-fold.

Headlines: EMA Updates on Pioglitazone and Varenicline
Teaser: The European drug regulator is recommending a label change for one drug, and a stay-the-course message for the second.

Headlines: Lower Concentration for Oseltamivir Oral Suspension
Teaser: The influenza drug will become available in the new 6 mg/mL formulation this month. The old 12 mg/mL version will remain on the market until supplies run out.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Counterfeit Morning-After Pill
Teaser: An unapproved morning-after pill called Evital has not been shown to be safe or effective in preventing pregnancy, the FDA warns.

Headlines: FDA: Avoid Methylene Blue or Linezolid With Serotonergics
Teaser: The FDA warns that coadministration of either methylene blue or linezolid  and certain serotonergic agents can lead to an interaction triggering serotonin syndrome.

Headlines: Can Lisinopril Cause Hyponatremia?
Teaser: Does this ACE inhibitor cause low sodium levels?

Headlines: Antiepileptic Drugs and Birth Defects
Teaser: Dr. Andrew Wilner discusses a recently published epidemiologic study evaluating the teratogenicity of 5 new antiepileptic agents.

Headlines: Bath Salts: An 'Ivory Wave' Epidemic?
Teaser: Are you aware of this dangerous "legal high"?

Headlines: Does Insulin Glargine Increase Cancer Risk in Children?
Teaser: What research is available regarding the risk of this long-acting insulin when used in children?

Headlines: Do Biologics Cause Cancer?
Teaser: Do the newer biologics for rheumatologic diseases increase risk for cancer?

Headlines: Switching From Simvastatin 80 mg: How to Shop for Statins
Teaser: Dr. Sandra Fryhofer discusses the recent FDA warnings on simvastatin 80 mg and offers solid suggestions on how to switch your patients to other agents.

Headlines: Few Adverse Events Linked to Vaccines, IOM Panel Says
Teaser: The expert committee also reported that scientific evidence favors rejecting a causal relationship between autism and the measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine.

Headlines: Macrolide Useful in COPD But May Cause Hearing Loss
Teaser: A macrolide antibiotic given daily for 1 year in addition to usual treatment reduced chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exacerbations and improved quality of life but caused hearing decrements.

Headlines: Simvastatin 80 mg: An FDA Expert Interview
Teaser: Medscape talked to the FDA's Amy Egan, MD, about drug safety communication on the 80-mg dose of simvastatin.

Headlines: High Doses of SSRI Linked to Abnormal Heart Rhythm
Teaser: The SSRI citalopram should not be used in doses higher than 40 mg/day because of concerns that it may cause abnormal and potentially fatal changes in heart rhythm.

Headlines: UK's NICE Wants More Cost-Effectiveness Data on Dabigatran
Teaser: NICE is requesting further cost-effectiveness analyses comparing dabigatran with warfarin using different effectiveness data and different scenarios for reflecting the cost of warfarin monitoring.

Headlines: Deaths Prompt Dabigatran Safety Advisory in Japan
Teaser: According to Boehringer Ingelheim, treatment with Prazaxa, as it is known in Japan, could not be completely ruled out as a cause of death in five patients, one of whom had kidney failure (a contraindication) and four of whom were aged over 80.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on Somatropin and Increased Risk for Death
Teaser: The FDA advises clinicians to still prescribe recombinant human growth hormone even as the agency continues to weigh a French study that linked the therapy to a higher risk for death.

Headlines: New Pioglitazone Label Highlights Bladder-Cancer Risk
Teaser: The updated label states that pioglitazone should not be started in patients with active bladder cancer and should be used with caution in patients with a prior history of bladder cancer.

Headlines: Caution Needed With Dabigatran (Pradaxa)
Teaser: Caution must be exercised when prescribing the new anticoagulant dabigatran to prevent stroke in atrial-fibrillation patients who are elderly and frail, say doctors.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Fluconazole (Diflucan) in Early Pregnancy
Teaser: The agency says long-term use of fluconazole (Diflucan) in high doses in the first trimester may be associated with birth defects.

Headlines: Biologics for Psoriasis May Not Raise Cardiovascular Risk
Teaser: Use of certain biologic therapies for psoriasis was not associated with a significant difference in rate of major adverse cardiovascular events vs placebo, but the study may have been underpowered.

Headlines: Atypical Antipsychotic Linked to Life-Threatening Reactions
Teaser: The FDA has issued a warning about the atypical antipsychotic Saphris, which has been linked to serious allergic reactions.

Headlines: HCV Therapy Can Cause Mild Depression to Spike
Teaser: Depressive symptoms may worsen during antiviral therapy among patients with hepatitis C virus, and notable changes in patients with subclinical depressive symptoms at baseline may be of most concern.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors and Bone Fractures: What's the Risk?
Teaser: Dr. David Johnson offers his perspective on a recent systematic review and meta-analysis that evaluated the potential risk for bone fractures associated with proton pump inhibitor use.

Headlines: Levothyroxine Dose and Risk for Fractures: Avoid Overtreatment
Teaser: Dr. JoAnn Manson reports on a recent study with practice implications for levothyroxine dosing in older adults.

Headlines: $$$$ Reward if Bachmann Proves Vaccine Causes 'Retardation'
Teaser: Bioethicist Arthur Caplan, PhD, offers $10,000 if GOP presidential hopeful Michele Bachmann proves that taking the HPV vaccine for cervical cancer has led to "retardation," as she recently claimed.

Headlines: Does Long-term Levothyroxine Use Cause Bone Loss?
Teaser: Can chronic use of levothyroxine put patients at risk for fractures?

Headlines: Duration of Bisphosphonate Use and the US Food and Drug Administration
Teaser: What does the recent US FDA vote regarding the need to clarify duration of bisphosphonate treatment mean for your patients? Dr. Andrew Kaunitz offers his recommendations.

Headlines: Incidence of Thromboembolic Events With Cisplatin Too High
Teaser: The incidence of thromboembolic events in patients receiving cisplatin-based chemotherapy is unacceptably high, a retrospective analysis concludes.

Headlines: NSAIDs in Early Pregnancy Linked to Risk for Miscarriage
Teaser: A case-control study shows a 2.4-fold increased risk for miscarriage in women who took any type and dosage of nonaspirin nonsteroidal anti inflammatory drugs in early pregnancy.

Headlines: Clarify Duration of Bisphosphonate Use, FDA Panel Says
Teaser: An FDA panel has advised the FDA to be more specific about the duration of bisphosphonate use for the treatment of osteoporosis.

Headlines: More Data Reignite Debate on ARB-Lung Cancer Risk
Teaser: A new study, this time in kidney-transplant recipients, has found that those who took ACE inhibitors or angiotensin-receptor blockers had an increased risk of respiratory tumors if they also had a history of smoking. Some dismiss the findings, but others say they warrant further investigation.

Headlines: Liraglutide's REMS: What's New?
Teaser: A recent FDA drug advisory highlighted the potential risks of liraglutide (Victoza®) in the treatment of type 2 diabetes, but was there anything new in the data or guidance? Dr. Anne Peters discusses the issue.

Headlines: Beware Bleeding With SSRIs and Antiplatelets
Teaser: Selective serotonin-reuptake inhibitor antidepressants appear to increase the risk of bleeding in patients taking antiplatelet agents, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Adverse Drug Reactions Often Preventable
Teaser: A meta-analysis shows that many adverse drug reactions that occur in the hospital and during emergency care are preventable.

Headlines: 5-Year Data: Hypofractionated Radiation for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: The newer technology reduces treatment time by 2.5 weeks, but late bladder toxicity is a concern.

Headlines: FDA Still 'Concerned' About Drospirenone VTE Risk
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration remains concerned about drospirenone-containing oral contraceptives and increased risk for venous thromboembolism.

Headlines: Europeans Looking Again at Orlistat and Liver Injury
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency says that it has started a review of orlistat-containing medicines to determine whether the "very rare cases of hepatic injury have an impact on their benefit/risk profile and conditions of use."

Headlines: French Judges Charge Servier Head in Mediator Scandal
Teaser: French magistrates allege that Jacques Servier engaged in dishonest practices and deception over the drug's quality and falsely obtained authorization to sell the controversial diabetes drug.

Headlines: EMA Recommends Restricting Use of Dronedarone
Teaser: The EMA committee states that because of the increased risk of liver, lung, and cardiovascular adverse events, dronedarone "should only be prescribed after alternative treatment options have been considered."

Headlines: IMRT Reduces GI and GU Toxicity in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Men treated with the newer technology had fewer late bowel and rectal complications than those treated with 3D-conformal radiation therapy.

Headlines: Ondansetron Linked to Arrhythmias, FDA Warns
Teaser: The FDA is revising the drug’s label to warn that patients with congenital long QT syndrome may run the risk for torsades de pointes.

Headlines: Clopidogrel Hypersensitivity Treated With Steroids a Success
Teaser: A new study has confirmed that virtually all patients with allergic reactions to clopidogrel respond favorably to a three-week course of prednisone, without having to interrupt antiplatelet therapy.

Headlines: Clarifying Simvastatin Warnings -- It's Not Just 80 mg
Teaser: Sandra Fryhofer, MD offers an important summary of the issues relating to simvastatin at all doses.

Headlines: Nonaspirin NSAID Use Linked to Risk for Renal Cell Cancer
Teaser: Data from 2 prospective studies show an association between long-term use of nonaspirin anti-inflammatory drugs and the risk for renal cell cancer.

Headlines: Qualitest Oral Contraceptives Recalled
Teaser: A packaging error has prompted generic drugmaker Qualitest Pharmaceuticals to recall multiple lots of oral contraceptives.

Headlines: Sepsis Drug Xigris Pulled From Worldwide Market
Teaser: Physicians should stop ongoing treatment with the drug now that it has failed a new efficacy test, according to the FDA.

Headlines: Thyroid Testing Urged for Cancer Patients On Newer Therapies
Teaser: Newer targeted therapies and immunotherapies are associated with thyroid dysfunction, which can be mistaken for drug toxicity and lead to unnecessary dosage reductions.

Headlines: FDA Provides Update on Drospirenone VTE Risk
Teaser: Further analysis of an FDA-funded study provides more evidence that drospirenone-containing oral contraceptives increase risk for venous thromboembolism, the agency says.

Headlines: Renal-Assessment Update Issued for Dabigatran
Teaser: Boehringer Ingelheim has agreed with the European Medicines Agencies to issue an update to the labeling for dabigatran.

Headlines: EMA Reviewing Safety of NSAIDs, Clarifies on Pioglitazone
Teaser: The EMA has launched a new review of the cardiovascular safety of NSAIDs, while also clarifying a previous opinion on the use of the antidiabetic agent pioglitazone and the risk of bladder of cancer.

Headlines: EMA Review Concludes: No Cancer Risk With ARBs
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency "concludes that benefit/risk balance of angiotensin-II-receptor antagonists remains positive," a press release from the agency states today.

Headlines: Erectile Dysfunction Common With Colorectal Cancer Treatment
Teaser: A small survey found that most men developed erectile dysfunction after their colorectal cancer treatment, and that it caused "profound distress."

Headlines: Long-Term Pulmonary Toxicity From Breast Irradiation
Teaser: There is good news from the first study -- a randomized trial -- reporting long-term toxicity outcomes after breast cancer therapy.

Headlines: How Young Is Too Young for Oseltamivir?
Teaser: Can very young children receive oseltamivir for influenza?

Headlines: MS Relapse Seen After Natalizumab Drug Holiday
Teaser: The risks of natalizumab treatment interruption, even with an alternative immunomodulatory therapy, appear to outweigh the theoretical benefits, researchers say.

Headlines: Fuel to the Fire or Flame Retardant? More on ARB Use/Cancer
Teaser: The use of angiotensin-receptor blockers or ACE inhibitors is not associated with a significantly increased risk of cancer, according to a new meta-analysis. The findings add yet another twist to the debate over whether or not the antihypertensive medications are associated with increased cancer incidence.

Headlines: Reassuring Findings on Anticholinergics in Dementia Patients
Teaser: New research suggests that medications with mild anticholinergic effects don't cause further cognitive decline in patients with Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Dabigatran: Australia Issues Bleeding Warning
Teaser: The Australian regulatory authority has issued a "safety advisory" on the new oral anticoagulant dabigatran because of an increase in the number of bleeding-related adverse events reports received since it was approved for use in AF patients.

Headlines: FDA Updates Warnings on Methylene Blue, Linezolid, and Serotonergics
Teaser: The agency now says that combining methylene blue or linezolid with SSRIs and SNRIs can trigger serotonin syndrome, but this risk may not apply to other serotonergic agents.

Headlines: Tenofovir Associated With Nonreversible Kidney Disease
Teaser: Tenofovir for treating HIV is associated with increased risk for kidney disease; this risk does not appear to be reversible after discontinuation.

Headlines: 4 Drugs Cause Most Adverse-Event Hospital Stays for Seniors
Teaser: Most emergency hospitalizations for seniors caused by adverse drug events involve a handful of anticoagulants and diabetes medications, according to a new study.

Headlines: Merck Vioxx Payout in US Approaches $1 Billion
Teaser: Concluding a long-running investigation into promotion of its COX-2 inhibitor, rofecoxib, Merck has agreed to pay out almost $1 billion to the US federal government and most states. But the company still does not admit any wrongdoing with regard to the cardiovascular safety of the drug.

Headlines: Joint Supplements for Aromatase Inhibitor Adverse Effects
Teaser: In combination, glucosamine and chondroitin appear to ease joint pain and improve function in breast cancer patients taking aromatase inhibitors.

Headlines: Is It GVHD or a Drug Hypersensitivity Reaction?
Teaser: How does one differentiate graft-vs-host disease from a drug hypersensitivity reaction?

Headlines: ASCO Updates Guidelines on Antiemetics
Teaser: New recommendations for preventing vomiting and nausea caused by cancer treatments are published.

Headlines: Game Changers in Obstetrics & Gynecology: 2011
Teaser: Don't miss Dr. Peter Kovacs' picks for the obstetrics and gynecology game-changing articles from 2011.

Headlines: Game Changers in Pharmacy Practice 2011
Teaser: A quick tour of the year's most important new studies and guidelines in pediatrics -- a must read for all pharmacists!

Headlines: Game Changers in Gastroenterology: 2011
Teaser: Did you miss these important papers in gastroenterology this year? Here's your second chance.

Headlines: Adverse CNS Effects of HCV Treatment Discourage Adherence
Teaser: Medications for hepatitis C virus (HCV) can exacerbate cognitive deficits that are already seen in patients with chronic liver disease, and pose a risk to treatment adherence.

Headlines: HIV Patients on HAART Have a Plethora of Ocular Diseases
Teaser: The prevalence of cataracts among HIV-positive patients receiving HAART is 10 times higher than in the rest of the American population, and the cataracts develop at a much younger age.

Headlines: Keeping SCORE: Corticosteroids for Retinal Vein Occlusions
Teaser: How are the results of the Standard Care vs COrticosteroid for REtinal Vein Occlusion (SCORE) Study affecting the management of macular edema associated with retinal vein occlusions?

Headlines: Transapical TAVI Stopped Due to Adverse Events: STACCATO
Teaser: A study comparing the transapical approach for transcatheter aortic-valve implantation against conventional aortic-valve replacement surgery was stopped early due to an increase in adverse events, including an increased risk of major stroke and severe paravalvular leakage, in elderly patients eligible for surgery.

Headlines: Dronedarone a Hazard in High Risk Patients With Permanent AF
Teaser: The antiarrhythmic, approved for paroxysmal or intermittent AF, upped the risk of stroke, heart failure, and arrhythmic death in patients with permanent AF and other CV risk factors.

Headlines: Buflomedil-Containing Drugs May Be Suspended in EU
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency is recommending suspension of all buflomedil-containing medicines.

Headlines: Dabigatran: 260 Fatal Bleeds Since Approval Worldwide
Teaser: Events occurred from March 2008 to October 31, 2011. European regulators are monitoring the issue and say that changes to the drug's current usage instructions 'adequately manage the risk of bleeding.'

Headlines: Are Colonics Safe?
Teaser: Does research support the use of this ancient practice?

Headlines: Can Zinc Treat the Common Cold?
Teaser: What can we tell patients about use of zinc for treatment and prevention of the common cold?

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics of Clopidogrel: Clinical Implications
Teaser: Dr. Deepak Voora reviews current data on the clinical benefit of testing for CYP2C19*2 alleles to identify poor metabolizers of clopidogrel therapy.

Headlines: FDA Warns About Potential Mix-Ups With Durezol and Durasal
Teaser: Because the product names are similar, a pharmacist accidentally dispensed the wart remover instead of the prescription eye drops to a patient, leading to a serious injury.

Headlines: Don't Use Vemurafenib in Earlier-Stage Melanomas
Teaser: Could RAF inhibitors cause other cancers over time?

Headlines: FDA Relaxes REMS Requirements on 2 Low Platelet Drugs
Teaser: The US FDA has dropped a requirement that prescribers and patients enroll in a monitoring network to use Nplate and Promacta, among other changes.

Headlines: FDA Investigating Serious Bleeding Events With Dabigatran
Teaser: The agency wants to know whether bleeding events are occurring more commonly than would be expected based on data from the RE-LY trial.

Headlines: Baseline 'Bother' Predicts Quitting Aromatase Inhibitors
Teaser: What is associated with postmenopausal women discontinuing aromatase inhibitors?

Headlines: American Dental Association Updates Osteonecrosis Guidelines
Teaser: Shifting away from an emphasis on intravenous bisphosphonates, the American Dental Association Council on Scientific Affairs points to a dose-response effect with antiresorptive therapy.

Headlines: FDA Revises Dose for Simvastatin With Amiodarone
Teaser: The agency is raising the allowed dose for simvastatin in combination with the cardiac drug back to 20 mg after mistakenly lowering it to 10 mg in June.

Headlines: FDA to Study Death of Patient After First Fingolimod Dose
Teaser: The agency said it still believes the benefits of the drug to treat relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis outweigh potential risks. The cause of the patient's death remains to be determined.

Headlines: Adverse Events When Aliskiren Added to ACE, ARB Therapy
Teaser: Data and safety monitors for ALTITUDE noted that patients in the trial taking aliskiren instead of placebo on top of ACE or ARB therapy experienced an increased incidence of nonfatal stroke, renal complications, hyperkalemia, and hypotension.

Headlines: New Evidence Addresses ADHD Meds and Adult CVD Risk
Teaser: A large observational study provides reassuring news on the safety of medications for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder in middle-aged adults, researchers say.

Headlines: Riata ICD Lead 'Alert' Is Now a Class I Recall
Teaser: The US FDA has designated a recent physician advisory letter relating to St Jude Medical's Riata family of ICD leads as a class I recall, the most serious. The letter, issued last month, warned doctors that more leads than it first thought were affected by a problem related to insulation failure.

Headlines: Top 10 Pharmacists Articles: 2011
Teaser: What articles on Medscape Pharmacists were the most widely read in 2011? A quick look back.

Headlines: 2011 Most-Read Articles by Primary Care Physicians
Teaser: Here are the articles that were of most interest to Medscape's internal medicine and family physician members in 2011.

Headlines: Bisphosphonate-Related Osteonecrosis of the Jaw
Teaser: What does this study really tell dentists and other clinicians?

Headlines: Can Iron Worsen Infection?
Teaser: Does iron supplementation help or hinder infection management?

Headlines: Are You Monitoring Diabetes Patients' Kidney Function?
Teaser: Dr. Per-Henrik Groop, President of the European Diabetic Nephropathy Study Group, warns clinicians to monitor kidney function in patients with type 2 diabetes and to adjust their diabetes medications as needed.

Headlines: What To Do About Misleading Drug Ads
Teaser: The FDA can't be everywhere. What is the responsibility of healthcare providers to try and rein in misleading pharmaceutical advertisements?

Headlines: Poor Long-Term Survival After ICU Acute Kidney Injury
Teaser: Long-term survival remains poor after acute kidney injury (AKI) in the intensive care unit, but most of those who do survive don't need maintenance dialysis.

Headlines: New AAN Guideline on Cannabis, Alternative Medicine in MS
Teaser: The guideline gives some support to cannabis products but emphasizes there is little evidence for most complementary and alternative medicine in multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: ASCO Updates Node Dissection Early Breast Cancer Guideline
Teaser: Many women with early-stage breast cancer can avoid the more invasive axillary lymph node dissection, and instead have sentinel node biopsy, which has fewer complications.

Headlines: Sanofi Faces Make-or-Break Verdict on Big Dengue Vaccine Bet
Teaser: Sanofi expects final clinical results for its vaccine against dengue by late September and has already gambled on starting production despite some disappointing early trials data.

Headlines: New Agent Offers Promise for ALK-Positive NSCLC
Teaser: Ceritinib, a new targeted therapy, has demonstrated effectiveness in this patient subgroup, even in those who have progressed on crizotinib.

Headlines: Unlike FDA, Europe Does Not Like Melanoma Combo Yet
Teaser: The combination of trametinib and dabrafenib was approved by the FDA in January, but a European regulatory committee feels differently.

Headlines: Provaccine Messages May Backfire Among Parents
Teaser: Researchers have found that current public health messages may be reducing the misperception about vaccines and autism but not increasing intent to vaccinate future children.

Headlines: ECT: Electrode Placement, Age Influence Depression Outcomes
Teaser: In individuals with severe depression who are treated with ECT, electrode placement and patient age may have a significant influence on treatment outcomes.

Headlines: Nintedanib: New Oral Angiogenesis Inhibitor in Lung Cancer
Teaser: When added to docetaxel in second-line therapy, the new agent improved survival in a subgroup of patients with adenocarcinoma histology.

Headlines: SSRI May Negatively Affect Male Fertility
Teaser: The SSRI sertraline may have a negative impact on some semen parameters, a finding that may have implications for male fertility.

Headlines: Memantine Discontinuation Rates Underestimated in Research?
Teaser: Randomized clinical trials may underestimate the rate of memantine discontinuation and dose reductions in dementia patients.

Headlines: No Benefit to Earlier Use of Bone Drug in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Use of zoledronic acid for castration-sensitive prostate cancer does not decrease the risk for skeletal events, compared with treatment started after progression to castration-resistant disease.

Headlines: Oral Immunotherapy Reduces Sensitivity to Dust Mites
Teaser: An experimental sublingual tablet cut nasal symptoms by half and conjunctivitis by two thirds in early investigation, say researchers.

Headlines: SBRT Cheaper but More Toxic Than IMRT for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) is cheaper but more toxic than intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT) for prostate cancer, according to a comparative study.

Headlines: Insulin-Related Hypoglycemia: Common, Costly, Preventable
Teaser: Insulin-related hypoglycemia leads to thousands of visits to emergency each year, especially among elderly patients, a new report shows. This is far too     common to be acceptable, says one expert.

Headlines: No Difference by Injection Approach for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Despite widespread belief of improved pain relief with transforaminal injections, randomized trials show no significant differences for relief of radiating low back pain or for function.

Headlines: TMS Relieves Symptoms in Teens With Resistant Depression
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation may be a useful therapy in teens with treatment-resistant depression, preliminary research suggests.

Headlines: PRAC Wants Restrictions on Domperidone Due to Cardiac Risks
Teaser: Reducing the recommended dose and duration of treatment with domperidone-containing antiemetics is key to minimizing its risks, the Committee said.

Headlines: EMA Panel Says Diacerein Should Stay, but With Restrictions
Teaser: After reexamining diacerein-containing medicines, an EU panel has recommended that these products remain available, although with restrictions to manage risks.

Headlines: Vision Loss Reported After Cosmetic Facial Injections
Teaser: Dermal filler injections in the forehead led to vision loss, a rare but devastating event, in 3 patients.

Headlines: Heart-Failure Data for Alogliptin Prompt More Debate at ACC
Teaser: The possible risk of heart failure associated with the use of the dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor drugs for type 2 diabetes is once again in the     spotlight, with new data from the ACC meeting.

Headlines: All That Glitters Is Not Gold: AleCardio Dissected at ACC
Teaser: Presentation of the AleCardio trial results at ACC provides a few more clues as to why the dual PPAR agonist aleglitazar has become the latest in a line of     these agents to fail spectacularly.

Headlines: Gilead Has Discounted HCV Drug for Some Health Plans
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc, under fire for pricing a new hepatitis C drug at $1,000 a pill, has discount agreements with a number of health insurers, a company executive said in an interview.

Headlines: FDA Approves Aveed Testosterone Jab, with Restrictions
Teaser: The FDA has approved Aveed, a long-acting depot form of testosterone, after 3 previous rejections, stipulating a boxed warning in the label and stringent     prescribing requirements.

Headlines: Nationwide Recall of Antidepressant Issued
Teaser: A nationwide recall of 3 different lots of the antidepressant Effexor has been issued by the drug's manufacturer due to possible contamination with a heart drug that could have fatal consequences.

Headlines: Single-Patient Studies Test Statin-Related Myalgia
Teaser: When exposing eight patients to several double-blind statin and placebo challenges, none had a statistically significant difference in myalgia or other     pain measures on the statin compared with placebo.

Headlines: Selecting an Initial ART Regimen: Lessons From ACTG 5257
Teaser: Drs. Paul Sax and Raphael Landovitz discuss the results from ACTG 5257 presented at CROI 2014 and the broader issues related to selecting an initial ART regimen for HIV infection.

Headlines: Malaria: Prevent, Diagnose, and Treat
Teaser: Malaria is still with us in this age of rapid global travel. Prevention is best, but when infection occurs, rapid diagnosis and treatment can save lives.

Headlines: Are Patients Getting the Gist?
Teaser: A unique study evaluates the 'gist' of patient-provider communications about rheumatic disease medications.

Headlines: A Young Woman With Unilateral Eye Pain and Erythema
Teaser: A 30-year-old woman presents with right eye pain, air and light sensitivity, and redness. What is your differential diagnosis, and what would you do next?

Headlines: NSAIDs: Not as Safe as Patients May Think
Teaser: What is the latest evidence regarding safe use of these all-too-common agents?

Headlines: Don't Prescribe 'T' Without 'E'
Teaser: The first Choosing Wisely recommendation from endocrinologists advises clinicians against prescribing testosterone ('T') to men without evidence ('E') of a reproducible testosterone deficiency.

Headlines: Adjuvant Chemo: Timing Isn't Everything
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr reviews data for the timing of adjuvant chemotherapy in pancreas, colorectal, and most breast cancers and concludes that a delay of 3 months is acceptable -- and possibly preferable.

Headlines: Emergency Contraception After Rape
Teaser: This article reviews what clinicians should know about the use of emergency contraception to prevent pregnancy from rape.

Headlines: Azithromycin Do's and Don'ts
Teaser: Treatment guidelines increasingly recommend that azithromycin not be used to treat many common infections. Are you prescribing it correctly? Test yourself with this case challenge.

Headlines: Penicillin Allergy: A Mountain or a Molehill?
Teaser: Almost 1 in 10 patients self-report an allergy to penicillin. How often is it really an issue?

Headlines: No Amount of Alcohol Is Safe
Teaser: Even light drinking increases the risk for certain cancers, according to contributors to the World Cancer Report.

Headlines: Open-Access Science for Better Cancer Drugs
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr says 90% of new cancer drugs 'fail.' To reverse this rate, he advocates a novel model for drug development in which science is shared in open-access, industry-academic partnerships.

Headlines: 'Low-Risk' Kidney Stone Removal May Be Risky and Costly
Teaser: After low-risk procedures to remove urinary stones, patients often need an unplanned emergency visit at substantial cost, suggesting a need for interventions to identify and reduce complications.

Headlines: ASCO Launches New Survivorship Guidelines
Teaser: ASCO has launched the first 3 guidelines as part of a series that will cover all aspects of cancer survivorship.

Headlines: Benefits of Delayed Umbilical Cord Clamping Gone by 12 Months
Teaser: Early benefits of delayed umbilical cord clamping (DCC) on iron stores seem to have disappeared by the time infants are one year old, researchers from Sweden report.

Headlines: AWARD-5: Dulaglutide Betters Sitagliptin in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: In patients with type 2 diabetes uncontrolled with metformin, adding weekly injections of dulaglutide led to better glycemic control at 1 year compared     with adding oral sitagliptin, with acceptable safety.

Headlines: Domperidone Restrictions Endorsed in EU Due to Cardiac Risk
Teaser: An EMA committee has confirmed recommendations to restrict the use of domperidone-containing antiemetics because of concerns about adverse cardiac effects.

Headlines: Novel Agents for Migraine Prevention Look Good in Phase 2
