Teaser: Two new agents representing a novel mechanism of action for the prevention of migraine are generating much interest after showing promising results in phase 2 studies.

Headlines: FDA Considers Ban on 'Noxious' Devices for Behavior Control
Teaser: The FDA is considering a complete ban on aversive electrical stimulation devices to control unwanted behaviors.

Headlines: Gastric Bypass: Appetite Drop, Food Aversion Common Afterward
Teaser: Moreover, patients who lose their taste for certain foods--typically meat--are more likely to attain greater weight loss, researchers report.

Headlines: Spinal Corticosteroids Run Risk of Severe Neuro Effects
Teaser: The FDA has announced that injections given to treat neck and back pain and radiating pain in the arms and legs may result, on rare occasions, in blindness, stroke, paralysis, and death.

Headlines: Glucantime Side Effects in Leishmaniasis Not Worse in Children
Teaser: Cutaneous leishmaniasis treatment with systemic meglumine antimoniate (Glucantime, Sanofi Aventis) is generally fairly well tolerated in children and the rate of adverse events is similar to that seen in adults.

Headlines: Exemestane Well-Tolerated for Breast Cancer Prevention
Teaser: When given to prevent breast cancer in postmenopausal women, the aromatase inhibitor exemestane has little effect on quality of life, according to follow-up results of the MAP.3 trial.

Headlines: In Prostate Hyperplasia, Combo Pill Slows Progress
Teaser: Men with moderate symptoms of benign prostate hyperplasia treated with dutasteride plus tamsulosin hydrochloride fared better than those monitored with watchful waiting, new research shows.

Headlines: Methotrexate Decreases Pain, Improves Function in Knee OA
Teaser: Methotrexate, which is widely used for rheumatoid arthritis, also reduced pain and improved function in patients with knee osteoarthritis in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Drug Trials to Take Spotlight at Liver Congress
Teaser: The European Association for the Study of the Liver International Liver Congress 2014 will feature phase 3 data on all-oral regimens for hepatitis C.

Headlines: Darapladib Fails to Reduce CVD Risk in STABILITY
Teaser: pproximately one in five patients treated with darapladib stopped taking the investigational Lp-PLA2 inhibitor because of adverse effects, including     malodorous feces, urine, and skin.

Headlines: Effects of Childhood Bullying Persist Well Into Adulthood
Teaser: Adults who were frequently bullied in childhood continue to be at risk for poorer mental, physical, and social health 4 decades later.

Headlines: ASCO's New Strategy to Define 'Value' in Cancer Care
Teaser: Under the leadership of the Value in Cancer Care Task Force, ASCO has launched a strategic initiative to define value in cancer care.

Headlines: Pharmacists Well Placed to Educate About Dietary Supplements
Teaser: Pharmacists can educate people about widely used dietary supplements that could be harmful, especially when used in the presence of certain chronic health conditions.

Headlines: Novel Nonopioid Approach Promising for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The combination of a muscle relaxant, an antihistamine, and an anticonvulsant may be a better way to detox opioid-dependent patients than a protocol that involves buprenorphine/naltrexone.

Headlines: FDA OKs Sublingual Grastek for Timothy Grass Pollen Allergy
Teaser: The FDA approved a grass pollen allergen extract for the treatment of Timothy grass pollen-induced allergic rhinitis, with or without conjunctivitis, in individuals aged 5 to 65 years.

Headlines: Lung Cancer: A Dose-Dependent Risk After Breast Cancer RT
Teaser: The risk of developing a primary lung cancer after radiotherapy for breast cancer increases in a dose-response manner, with these odds jumping 17-fold in smokers.

Headlines: Ocular Effects Common After Childhood Bone Marrow Transplant
Teaser: Children who undergo bone marrow transplantation can suffer ocular complications, such as cataract and dry eye syndrome, which can be long lasting and require treatment into adulthood.

Headlines: Calcium/CVD Risk Debate Gets New Fodder From Analysis
Teaser: The meta-analysis contradicts previous studies suggesting that calcium supplements could increase the risk of MI.

Headlines: Serious Side Effect Seen in MS Patients on Interferon Beta
Teaser: Unexpected cases of thrombotic microangiopathy have emerged in patients with MS taking a relatively new formulation of interferon beta in one report, but cases have been reported with all brands.

Headlines: ED Drugs Linked to Increased Melanoma Risk
Teaser: Data from the Health Professionals' Follow-up Study show a strong association between sildenafil use and melanoma risk.

Headlines: Mechanism for Ipilimumab Pituitary Toxicity Identified
Teaser: Expression of CTLA-4 on pituitary endocrine cells could underlie hypophysitis secondary to CTLA-4 blockade with ipilimumab, which has implications for care.

Headlines: First-in-Class Defibrotide for VOD Launched in Europe
Teaser: Defibrotide, a drug used to treat severe veno-occlusive disease (VOD), a life-threatening complication related to hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, has been launched in Europe.

Headlines: NIMH Tightens Up Funding Criteria for Clinical Trials
Teaser: In an effort to improve the development of treatments for psychiatric disorders, the NIMH has changed its funding policies for future clinical trials, including timelier reporting of results.

Headlines: Drilling Down on the Cholesterol Treatment Guidelines
Teaser: The Mayo Clinic outlines its approach to the new cholesterol guidelines.

Headlines: VEGF Inhibitors Safe for AMD, Despite Expectations
Teaser: In patients with age-related macular degeneration (AMD), cardiovascular risks might be more strongly associated with age than with vascular endothelial growth-factor (VEGF) inhibitors.

Headlines: Transcranial Stimulation in Disorders of Consciousness
Teaser: A short session of transcranial direct-current stimulation over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex may result in clinical improvement for patients in a minimally conscious state, early findings show.

Headlines: Why Does Hypokalemia Happen With Amphotericin B?
Teaser: Why does hypokalemia occur in patients receiving amphotericin B, and how can it be managed?

Headlines: Epilepsy: Cash, Car Accidents, and Psychiatric Side Effects
Teaser: Three important epilepsy studies were presented at this year's American Academy of Neurology Annual Meeting.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana for Neurologic Diseases
Teaser: A systematic review of the use of medical marijuana for neurologic disease has been unveiled, and selected benefits have been found.

Headlines: Registry vs RCT Data on Renal Denervation
Teaser: Dr. Felix Mahfoud comments on the differences between the SYMPLICITY HTN-3 trial and the global registry on renal denervation.

Headlines: Pharmacist Vaccinators: Issues and Liability Risks
Teaser: What do physicians think of pharmacist vaccination services, and should pharmacists be concerned about liability risks?

Headlines: A Tale of Two Treatment Worlds: Fat and Muscle Loss in HIV
Teaser: Dr. Benjamin Young reviews two recently published articles looking at side effects common to HIV antiretroviral therapies used in developing and developed countries.

Headlines: In Advanced CKD, Thiazide May Help Control BP
Teaser: Dr. George Bakris interviews Dr. Rajiv Agarwal about a small study that could redeem chlorthalidone's role in controlling blood pressure in patients with moderate to advanced chronic kidney disease.

Headlines: Managing Asthma During Pregnancy
Teaser: A key principle is that experiencing the symptoms of asthma during pregnancy is worse than the potential side effects of asthma medications.

Headlines: An Infant in Acute Respiratory Distress: Case Challenge
Teaser: Test your diagnostic approach to an infant who presents with increased work of breathing and fever.

Headlines: The Ongoing Debate Between Crystalloid and Colloid
Teaser: Aaron Holley, MD, reviews a decade-long debate on whether to use crystalloid or colloid for fluid resuscitation.

Headlines: New Guidelines on Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Medscape talks to Dr. Dawn Hershman about new ASCO guidelines on the prevention and treatment of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Don't Sue Me! Malpractice Pitfalls in Hospital Medicine
Teaser: Most clinicians with long careers will one day find themselves on the receiving end of a medical liability claim. Dr. Franklin Michota offers advice on how to minimize the risk of being sued.

Headlines: Tamoxifen for 10 Years an Option: ASCO Guideline Update
Teaser: Women with hormone receptor-positive breast cancer should consider taking tamoxifen for 10 years, ASCO says.

Headlines: Parathyroid Hormone for Hypoparathyroidism: More Data
Teaser: Further phase 3 trial results of recombinant human parathyroid hormone in patients with hypoparathyroidism show that almost all can cut out vitamin D, and     58% eliminate both calcium and vitamin-D supplements.

Headlines: Intensive Pain Rehab Improves Kids' Mental Health
Teaser: An intensive interdisciplinary pain rehabilitation program that focuses on the individual needs of each child improves psychological functioning in kids with a variety of pain conditions.

Headlines: IL-2 for Kidney Cancer Offers Cure
Teaser: High-dose interleukin-2 is still a viable treatment option for metastatic renal cell carcinoma, because it is the only truly curative option for advanced disease.

Headlines: Brodalumab Meets Goals in Phase 3 Psoriasis Study
Teaser: A drug under development by Amgen Inc and AstraZeneca Plc met the goals of a Phase 3 study in patients with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis, the companies said on Friday.

Headlines: Dual Therapy Effective in Newly Diagnosed HIV-1 Infection
Teaser: In previously untreated adults with HIV-1 infection, dual therapy with lopinavir and ritonavir plus lamivudine is as effective as triple therapy with lopinavir and ritonavir plus two NRTIs.

Headlines: CHMP Endorses Peginterferon-Beta-1a, Not Laquinimod, in MS
Teaser: After a second look at laquinimod, the EMA panel maintains that the benefits don't outweigh the potential risks of the drug.

Headlines: Macular Thinning on Fingolimod Treatment in MS
Teaser: A recent study shows a decrease in macular volume with 1 year of treatment of patients with MS receiving fingolimod. Whether this decrease correlates with a loss of brain volume is not yet known.

Headlines: Thromboprophylaxis in Cancer Patients: Needs Rethink
Teaser: Most hospitalized cancer patients receive thromboprophylaxis, but clinicians urgently need better tools for determining which cancer patients are likely to benefit.

Headlines: Dabigatran Crosses Placenta in Ex Vivo Experiment
Teaser: With ex vivo data showing dabigatran can cross the placenta, its safety during pregnancy is questionable, researchers say.

Headlines: Ondansetron, Metoclopramide Similar in Head-to-Head Trial
Teaser: Ondansetron is more expensive but no better than metoclopramide in treating morning sickness in pregnant women; women taking metoclopramide reported more minor adverse effects.

Headlines: Hospital-Acquired Conditions and Readmits on Downswing
Teaser: Medicare readmissions decreased again in 2013, and fewer hospital-acquired infections, falls, and drug mishaps in 2011 and 2012 saved almost 15,000 lives, according to HHS.

Headlines: Salt and Battery: Debate on Sodium Targets Gets Feisty
Teaser: The PURE study suggests that low sodium intake is linked with increased cardiovascular risks, but the question of sodium targets is far from settled, with     a corresponding debate on the topic getting oddly personal.

Headlines: Methylprednisolone to Reduce Strictures After Esophageal Burns
Teaser: High doses of methylprednisolone can reduce stricture formation after esophageal burns in children who ingest caustic substances, researchers from Turkey report.

Headlines: Few Hospices Providing CAM Services to Patients
Teaser: Only 29% of hospices in the United States employ complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) therapists for massage, music, or art therapy, despite the growing interest in these services.

Headlines: FDA Clears Dalbavancin (Dalvance) for Acute Skin Infections
Teaser: The antibacterial agent is the first designated as a Qualified Infectious Disease Product (QIDP) to receive FDA approval.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Eyed as Obesity Treatment
Teaser: Already approved for the treatment of diabetes, the incretin mimetic liraglutide is now being investigated as a potential weight-loss drug.

Headlines: Friday at ASCO: Improving Quality of Life
Teaser: Oncology is not just about helping people to live longer, but also involves strategies that will improve patients' quality of life, says ASCO expert.

Headlines: FDA Okays First Device for Restless Legs Syndrome
Teaser: The FDA will allow marketing of the Relaxis pad (Sensory Medical Inc), a nonpharmacologic approach to improve sleep quality in RLS.

Headlines: Exercise Benefits of Caffeine Might Be Genetic
Teaser: Caffeine helps sedentary people become more active, but genetic differences could determine who will get an athletic boost, a pair of studies suggest.

Headlines: Acute Radiation Skin Toxicity Possible With BRAF Inhibitors
Teaser: Five cases point to a potential unanticipated interaction between BRAF inhibitors and ionizing radiation, leading to acute skin toxicity.

Headlines: New Glatiramer Dosing Convenient, Possibly Safer, in MS
Teaser: Patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis who inject glatiramer acetate 3 times a week instead of daily experience fewer injection site reactions and may, over time, avoid lipoatrophy.

Headlines: Appears Safe to Delay ADT When Prostate Cancer Recurs
Teaser: Delaying androgen-deprivation therapy in men who have biochemical recurrence of prostate cancer did not affect survival in a new study.

Headlines: Don't Treat Early-Stage Prostate Cancer in Older, Sicker Men
Teaser: Older men diagnosed with early-stage prostate cancer who have pre-existing medical conditions, such as diabetes, COPD, and heart disease, derive no survival benefit from aggressive treatment.

Headlines: BMJ Withdraws Statement on Statin-Related AEs
Teaser: Two research papers erroneously cited that 20% of patients develop statin-related adverse events, a figure that is based on observational data. These     statements have been withdrawn and BMJ will review next steps.

Headlines: TMS Cost-effective for Resistant Depression
Teaser: An economic analysis suggests transcranial magnetic stimulation is "good value for money" in patients with antidepressant-resistant major depression.

Headlines: NSAID Monotherapy Prevents Postsurgery Cystoid Macular Edema
Teaser: Bromfenac monotherapy prevented cystoid macular edema after cataract surgery better than a steroid plus an NSAID, in a 5-year analysis.

Headlines: Online Sex Supplements Linked to Serious Psychoactive Effects
Teaser: Ingredients found in sexual enhancement products sold online, such as yohimbine and horny goat weed, have been linked to several psychoactive effects, including anxiety, panic, and hallucinations.

Headlines: Nonstimulant May Provide Rapid Relief for Adult ADHD
Teaser: An extended-release formulation of the nonstimulant metadoxine improves attention after a single dose in adults with predominantly inattentive ADHD.

Headlines: TMS Promising for Generalized Anxiety
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation appears to be a promising treatment for patients with generalized anxiety disorder, a frequently chronic condition characterized by debilitating worry.

Headlines: FDA Panel Rejects OTC Use of Montelukast (Singulair Allergy)
Teaser: The FDA advisory committee has recommended against use of partial expansion of montelukast for OTC use against allergic rhinitis.

Headlines: Physical Therapy May Not Be Helpful for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Physical therapy for patients with hip osteoarthritis was associated with mild temporary increases in pain in the hip or back that tended to resolve over time.

Headlines: EHR Divide Is Widening Among Physicians, CDC Says
Teaser: Even a single episode of binge drinking can cause bacterial leakage from the gut, which in turn can lead to the release of endotoxins in the bloodstream.

Headlines: Single Binge Drinking Episode Drives Systemic Toxicity
Teaser: A fifth of older people hospitalized for hypoglycemia will have died within a year, say the authors of a newly published study; they call for diabetes     treatment goals to be softened in these patients.

Headlines: PFOS Detected in Pease Tradeport Water System
Teaser: A new series of articles in Epilepsia examine the potential use of cannabidiol and medical marijuana in young patients with epilepsy.

Headlines: Ranbaxy Recalls Nearly 30,000 Packs of Allergy-Relief Drug in US
Teaser: Indian drugmaker Ranbaxy Laboratories started recalling 29,790 packs of an allergy-relief medicine in the US in February after finding defects in the packaging.

Headlines: Pixantrone a 'Milestone' for Aggressive Relapsed B-cell NHL
Teaser: Patients with aggressive B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) who have failed after second-line therapy have few options: now pixantrone can be used in Europe.

Headlines: Psyllium as Effective as Loperamide for Fecal Incontinence
Teaser: Episodes of fecal incontinence can be nearly halved with either psyllium fiber or loperamide, a crossover placebo-controlled trial has shown.

Headlines: Specialized Clinic Gets Results in Resistant Hypertension
Teaser: The clinic, which includes a dietician, nurse practitioners, and physicians, including cardiologists and nephrologists, saw patients reduce their systolic     BP from 153 mm Hg to 130 mm Hg.

Headlines: Drug Reactions More Likely in Kids With Complex Conditions
Teaser: Children with complex chronic conditions were 4 times as likely to visit the emergency department for an adverse drug event as other children.

Headlines: High Dropout Rate in Active Surveillance for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A real-world study of men with prostate cancer indicates that more than one third of men who undergo active surveillance drop out.

Headlines: Pre-praziquantel Snack Beneficial in Childhood Schistosomiasis
Teaser: Giving a snack prior to praziquantel treatment improved compliance and reduced the burden of schistosomiasis among children in Uganda, according to a new study.

Headlines: Experts Debate Use of Cannabis to Control Seizures
Teaser: When it comes to EHR adoption, physicians in large practices are outpacing soloists. The gap between primary care physicians and specialists has grown as well.

Headlines: Nintedanib Slows Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Progression
Teaser: The tyrosine kinase inhibitor slowed the decline in lung function over a year in 2 phase 3 trials, providing hope for another therapeutic option for these patients.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Treatment: Hope on the Horizon
Teaser: Highly effective, tolerable treatment options for hepatitis C offer hope to patients and providers.

Headlines: 5 Ways to Help Your Cancer Patients Be More Compliant
Teaser: Getting cancer patients to follow your instructions sometimes starts not with the patient, but with the doctor. Here's what you can do to improve compliance.

Headlines: EGFR Inhibitor Poised to Change Practice in NSCLC
Teaser: Drs. Mark Kris and Luis Paz-Ares highlight lung cancer presentations from ASCO 2014, including a promising agent in squamous cell and a new EGFR-TKI that overcomes resistance and may change practice.

Headlines: New ACS Guide for PCPs Managing Prostate Cancer Survivors
Teaser: Detailed guidelines advise primary care physicians on medical and psychosocial aspects of survivorship.

Headlines: Drinking Water: What's the Science?
Teaser: Who should drink how much water? Bottled or tap? Dr. Jeffrey Berns and Dr. Stanley Goldfarb discuss the evidence and what you should tell patients.

Headlines: Nivolumab Appears 'Promising' in RCC
Teaser: Drs. Bernard Escudier and Nicholas Vogelzang highlight studies in kidney and bladder cancer presentations from ASCO 2014.

Headlines: New Weight-Loss Drugs: When to Prescribe?
Teaser: Dr. Steven Smith reviews 2 weight-loss drugs in the pipeline, liraglutide and naltrexone/bupropion, and discusses how to prescribe such drugs and appropriate patients to receive them.

Headlines: No Added Cognitive Risk to Breast-Fed Kids of Moms on AEDs
Teaser: In a new report from the NEAD study, school-aged youngsters whose mothers took antiepileptic drugs while breast-feeding scored higher on IQ test than those whose mothers didn't breast-feed them.

Headlines: Selumetinib Yields Modest Benefits in Rare Eye Cancer
Teaser: The first randomized controlled trial of the MEK inhibitor selumetinib finds modest improvement in clinical outcomes of advanced uveal melanoma but high rates of adverse effects.

Headlines: Attitudes Affect Adherence to Inflammatory Disease Meds
Teaser: For a range of chronic immune-mediated inflammatory diseases, patients' beliefs and concerns can influence how well they adhere to drug therapy, new research shows.

Headlines: Lithium, Quetiapine Equally Effective for Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: Lithium and the second-generation antipsychotic quetiapine have similar efficacy, a real-world, head-to-head comparison shows.

Headlines: Ruxolitinib Provides New Benchmarks in Polycythemia Vera
Teaser: The JAK1/JAK2 inhibitor improved signs and symptoms of the disease in a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: New Antibiotic Tedizolid (Sivextro) Approved by FDA
Teaser: Tedizolid phosphate is the second antibiotic for acute skin infections that the agency has okayed in the last 5 weeks.

Headlines: Hospitalization Rates Drop With LAIs in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Switching patients with schizophrenia from oral antipsychotics to a long-acting injectable antipsychotic can result in a significant drop in rates of hospitalization for psychotic episodes.

Headlines: Combo Scores High in Ovarian Cancer, for Now
Teaser: Drs. Stanley Kaye and Robert Coleman highlight the gynecologic presentations of ASCO 2014, including a positive PARP combination trial, early results for immunotherapy, and a test for bevacizumab use.

Headlines: Treating Atrial Fibrillation: Drugs, Ablation, or Neither?
Teaser: Is a pro/con debate on whether catheter ablation of AF will render antiarrhythmic drugs obsolete missing the point? Dr John Mandrola gives a recap of the debate held at CardioStim this week and asks why lifestyle modification was left out.

Headlines: 'Pretty Darn Impressive' PD-1 Data in Melanoma
Teaser: Drs. Antoni Ribas and Jeffrey Weber discuss the exceptional data for melanoma in immuno- and targeted therapies presented at ASCO 2014.

Headlines: Marijuana for Arthritis and Pain: Is There a Role?
Teaser: A look at the evidence on medical marijuana for rheumatologic conditions.

Headlines: For Noncompliant Patients, a Fix That Works
Teaser: Help your patients become more compliant -- taking medications as prescribed, going on a diet, drinking less, or quitting smoking -- without adding to the length of their visits. Here's how.

Headlines: 10 ASCO Takeaways for Primary Care Physicians
Teaser: ASCO Immediate Past President Dr. Clifford Hudis discusses the results of 10 studies from ASCO 2014 with relevance across the medical specialties.

Headlines: My Top Six Stupid Insurance Company Directives
Teaser: Dr Walton-Shirley has a therapeutic rant about the time wasted responding to dubious insurance company directives. She ends with a call to action     to (hopefully) end the madness.

Headlines: Ibrutinib Stands Center Stage in CLL
Teaser: Dr. John Gribben highlights new data on single and combination therapies for CLL as presented at EHA 2014.

Headlines: Three-Drug Combo Improves Multiple Myeloma Response
Teaser: Dr. Paul Richardson discusses recent results of the PANORAMA trial in relapsed, refractory multiple myeloma as presented at ASCO and EHA.

Headlines: A 4-Week Hep C Cure? Bristol to Test Drugs With Gilead's Sovaldi
Teaser: In the race to find a faster cure for hepatitis C, Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said it will test its experimental antiviral drug combination with Gilead Sciences Inc's blockbuster drug Sovaldi (sofosbuvir).

Headlines: A Home Run for Hepatitis C Treatment
Teaser: Dr. William Balistreri describes the rapidly evolving landscape of hepatitis C treatment.

Headlines: An Option for Migraine Prevention?
Teaser: Although not yet approved for migraine, candesartan is promising in a placebo-controlled comparison trial.

Headlines: Thalidomide for Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia Epistaxis
Teaser: Partial or complete response is achieved with low-dose thalidomide when other therapies have failed; however, relapses are common.

Headlines: Shire to Test Its ADHD Drug in 4- to 5-Year-Olds in U.S.
Teaser: Shire Plc has agreed to a U.S. Food and Drug Administration request to study its stimulant Vyvanse in preschool children as concern rises over the diagnosis and treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

Headlines: BRAF Inhibitor Is Effective in Hairy Cell Leukemia
Teaser: The drug could be important for the many patients who lose response or relapse with the most effective conventional therapies.

Headlines: Stopping Immunotherapy Possible in Some Patients With Lupus
Teaser: Some patients with systemic lupus erythematosus who are in clinical remission with immunosuppressant therapy may be able to stop therapy without triggering a new disease flare.

Headlines: FDA Panel Debates CV Safety of Opioid Constipation Drugs
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee agreed that cardiovascular outcomes trials aren't necessary for an emerging class of drugs that decrease the gastrointestinal adverse effects of opioids without reducing analgesia.

Headlines: Choosing Wisely With Kids
Teaser: The experts discuss the key take-away messages from AAP's recent Choosing Wisely list.

Headlines: Third Meningococcal Vaccine Recommended for Children at Risk
Teaser: A third meningococcal vaccine is an additional option for children at increased risk for meningococcal disease.

Headlines: Marijuana Tied to Addiction, Long-term Cognitive Dysfunction
Teaser: Marijuana use is linked to several adverse effects, including addiction and long-term cognitive dysfunction.

Headlines: Psychotropic Drugs Can Reduce Bone Mass in Kids
Teaser: A study has found that SSRIs and risperidone can have deleterious effects on bone mass formation and accrual in children who take these medications on a long-term basis.

Headlines: With  Methotrexate Tx, Noninvasive Tests to Avoid Liver Biopsy
Teaser: Noninvasive testing may be useful for spotting potential hepatotoxicity and confirming the need for liver biopsy in psoriasis patients on methotrexate sodium, according to Irish researchers who say more studies are needed.

Headlines: EMA Panel Recommends Approval for Flutemetamol in AD
Teaser: The PET tracer received a positive opinion from the CHMP for detection of amyloid-beta neuritic plaques in the brain in diagnosis of patients suspected of having Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: EU Panel Gives Nod to Triple Combo Pill for HIV (Triumeq)
Teaser: The EU’s Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has given a positive opinion for marketing of Triumeq, a once-daily combination of the antivirals dolutegravir, abacavir, and lamivudine.

Headlines: T-DM1 Now Preferred for Progressive HER2 Breast Cancer
Teaser: T-DM1, a successor to trastuzumab, should be the preferred choice for HER2-positive breast cancer that has progressed despite multiple lines of treatment, new research shows.

Headlines: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Plus Inositol Promising in Pediatric BPD
Teaser: In this pilot double-blind RCT, combined treatment with omega-3 fatty acids and inositol reduced symptoms of mania and depression in young children with bipolar spectrum disorders.

Headlines: Anticholinergic Nasal Spray Eases Rhinorrhea in Parkinson's
Teaser: Rhinorrhea is common in Parkinson's disease but not well recognized or studied; anticholinergic nasal spray eases symptoms.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against Accelerated Approval for Olaparib
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends waiting for phase 3 data before considering approval for olaparib as maintenance therapy for recurrent ovarian cancer.

Headlines: TESLA: Evolocumab Clears Hurdle in Homozygous FH
Teaser: Added on top of a statin and ezetimibe, evolocumab reduced LDL cholesterol 23% compared with an 8% increase among the placebo-treated patients. Experts     hope the drug class can be used for hard-to-treat HoFH patients.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Combo Improves Outcomes in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The combination of 2 investigational drugs, olaparib and cediranib, holds promise as a nonchemotherapy approach to ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Sunday at ASCO: Hot News From Plenary Session
Teaser: The plenary session today will hear potentially practice-changing results in breast and prostate cancer, and reassuring results in colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Sausage Link? Heart-Failure Risk Higher with Processed Meats
Teaser: That's not the wurst of it. While the incident heart-failure risk went up significantly with consumption of any form of processed meat, so did the risk of     heart-failure death--and more sharply.

Headlines: Screen for Hydroxychloroquine Retinopathy to Preserve Vision
Teaser: Hydroxychloroquine retinopathy can cause damage that may continue for 3 or more years after the drug is discontinued and greatly reduce the amount of visual loss.

Headlines: Study Finds Metformin Works Better in African Americans
Teaser: Findings from a large health system database suggest that, across several different analyses, glucose-lowering with metformin was consistently better among     African Americans compared with whites.

Headlines: Levodopa Best Choice for Initial Parkinson's Treatment
Teaser: The largest ever drug trial in Parkinson's disease found that levodopa beats dopamine agonists and monoamine oxidase type B inhibitors in terms of patient-reported mobility, quality of life, and other measures.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Topical Triazole Antifungal for Onychomycosis
Teaser: Efinaconazole (Jublia) is the first triazole antifungal to be developed for the treatment of distal lateral subungual onychomycosis.

Headlines: FDA Approves Bunavail for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new drug for the maintenance treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: What's Hot at EULAR 2014
Teaser: TNF-alpha inhibitors, biosimilars, and the IL-17 pathway are just a few of the topics on the EULAR program that have its scientific chair excited.

Headlines: Ketamine Metabolite Has Promise in Depression
Teaser: Hydroxynorketamine may treat symptoms of depression without ketamine's unwanted side effects and also shows potential in neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.

Headlines: FDA OKs Aloxi for Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting in Children
Teaser: The FDA has approved palonosetron HCL (Aloxi, Eisai Inc and Hensinn Group) injection for the prevention of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children aged 1 month to less than 17 years.

Headlines: Novel Compound Shows Promise in Diabetic Nephropathy
Teaser: Emapticap pegol showed significant and sustained anti-inflammatory effects in diabetic nephropathy in a phase 2 trial.

Headlines: Hope on Horizon for Newer Obesity Drugs in Europe?
Teaser: The lack of obesity drugs in Europe was the focus of much discussion at the European   Conference on Obesity last week. Hopes are high that     bupropion/naltrexone and liraglutide will soon be approved there.

Headlines: Life-Threatening Adverse Drug Reactions Likely to Recur
Teaser: Two serious skin conditions, Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, are rare, but had a high recurrence rate in a population-based cohort study.

Headlines: Is Ipilimumab Useful for Earlier-Stage Melanoma?
Teaser: A randomized placebo-controlled trial provides relapse-free survival results for patients with stage III disease.

Headlines: More on HF Hospitalization With Gliptins in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new post hoc analysis of the VIVIDD study with the DPP-4 inhibitor vildagliptin in patients with type 2 diabetes and heart failure has shown that the drug is not associated     with an increase in hospitalizations for HF.

Headlines: Tapentadol is 'Third-Tier' Drug for Diabetic Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Tapentadol improves the quality of life of patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy, but because it is a narcotic and expensive, it is     relegated to a third-tier treatment, says one expert.

Headlines: IV Theophylline Quickly Reduces Lumbar Puncture Headache
Teaser: A small study shows that the pain common after lumbar puncture or spinal anesthesia quickly resolves with IV theophylline, with the greatest relief in the first 30 minutes but continuing out to 60 minutes.

Headlines: Air Pollution Linked to Mixed, Small Health Effects
Teaser: UK researchers have found 'no clear evidence' of possible links between ambient air pollution and cardiovascular deaths in England and Wales.

Headlines: Stopping Statins Safe, Cuts Costs, in Terminal Patients
Teaser: About $600 million could be saved if statins were stopped in every patient with less than a year's life expectancy; a new study shows such discontinuation is safe.

Headlines: Antidepressant-Related Weight Gain: Not All Agents Equal
Teaser: Data for a 12-month period show modest differences in the amount of weight patients taking common antidepressant medications are likely to gain.

Headlines: Few Breast-Cancer Patients With HF Referred to Cardiologists
Teaser: A new study puts the number of women with diagnosed HF or cardiomyopathy secondary to their breast-cancer treatments at 12%, yet only one-third are     promptly referred for a cardiology workup.

Headlines: Naloxegol Reduces Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: A new study shows naloxegol, a member of a class of agents that decreases gastrointestinal adverse effects without affecting analgesia, increases bowel movements.

Headlines: TAC, AC+T Linked to Higher Toxicity in Early Breast Cancer
Teaser: Early-stage breast cancer patients under 65 had more hospitalizations after TAC or AC+T than after standard TC, and older patients had more hospitalizations after any regimen other than ddAC+P.

Headlines: Natalizumab Continued Past 24 Months Safely in MS
Teaser: Results from the TY-STOP observational study show patients with MS safely continued natalizumab past 24 months and had less disease activity vs going to a different drug or stopping all together.

Headlines: Tight Glycemic Control More 'Burden' Than Benefit for Many
Teaser: Benefits of tight glycemic control are often outweighed by treatment "burden" from side effects such as weight gain, hypoglycemia, or needing frequent     insulin injections, according to new research.

Headlines: Celecoxib May Reduce Pain After Face-lift
Teaser: The COX-2 inhibitor does not have the considerable adverse effects of opioids, but the cost is high, and insurance may not cover it.

Headlines: Prescribing Sedatives and Anxiolytics: Take Care!
Teaser: Prescribers need to be aware of the safety risks associated with these drugs and the new lower recommended doses for some.

Headlines: EU Restrictions on Bromocriptine for Inhibiting Lactation?
Teaser: The EMA committee has concluded that 'rare but potentially serious...cardiovascular, neurological, and psychiatric side effects cannot be ruled out.'

Headlines: Apremilast Shows Promise for Inflammatory Rosacea
Teaser: The oral phosphodiesterase inhibitor apremilast relieves signs of inflammatory rosacea, according to a pilot study in patients with moderate to severe disease.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Pain on Stopping Imatinib: Should We Worry?
Teaser: A first report on a withdrawal syndrome documents patients with chronic myelogenous leukemia with musculoskeletal pain after imatinib withdrawal.

Headlines: Teenagers With Cancer at Risk for Severe Menstrual Bleeding
Teaser: Cancer treatment can put teenage girls at high risk for heavy menstrual bleeding, so new guidelines suggest that gynecologists should be involved in their care.

Headlines: One-Dose Antiemetic Eases Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting
Teaser: A single oral dose of netupitant plus palonosetron at the beginning of a chemotherapy cycle prevented nausea and vomiting for most cancer patients.

Headlines: US Cigar Smoking Doubles, Variety of Products Available
Teaser: In the United States, cigarette consumption declined during 2000 to 2011, but consumption of cigars more than doubled during the same period, according to the CDC.

Headlines: FDA Clears Olodaterol (Striverdi Respimat) for COPD
Teaser: The once-daily inhaled long-acting beta-agonist is for long-term maintenance treatment of airflow obstruction in patients with COPD, including chronic bronchitis and/or emphysema.

Headlines: No Evidence, Yet ADT Often Used in Localized Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Androgen-deprivation therapy (ADT) is not associated with improved survival in men with localized prostate cancer, yet it is frequently used.

Headlines: IL-17 Inhibition May 'Change Paradigm' of Psoriasis Treatment
Teaser: The selective interleukin-17 (IL-17) inhibitor secukinumab (Novartis) produced rapid, robust and, with continued treatment, long-lasting relief of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in two phase 3 studies.

Headlines: Another Injectable Treatment for Diabetes on the Horizon
Teaser: Enticing findings with fibroblast growth factor in mice suggest an insulin-sensitizing role, independent of mitogenic effects, with the potential to     normalize blood glucose with few side effects.

Headlines: HPS2-THRIVE: As Niacin Fails, HDL's Role Is  Debated Anew
Teaser: UPDATED // Given the negative results from AIM-HIGH and HPS2-THRIVE, as well as other negative studies, the cardiovascular research community is grappling with the     future of managing HDL-cholesterol levels to reduce clinical risk.

Headlines: CLARINET Results: Lanreotide First Line for Metastatic NETs
Teaser: The somatostatin analogue lanreotide has shown antitumor benefits in many types of metastatic neuroendocrine tumors (NETs), including intestinal tumors.

Headlines: ADHD Drugs Not Tested for Safety, Efficacy Over Time
Teaser: A review of ADHD clinical drug trials shows the majority of studies were too small and too short to effectively assess long-term safety and efficacy of the agents or detect rare adverse events.

Headlines: Inhaled Steroids May Suppress Growth in Children With Asthma
Teaser: Inhaled corticosteroids may suppress growth in the first year of treatment in children with asthma, but lower doses may minimize the effects, according to 2 Cochrane reviews.

Headlines: Mental-Health Risks of Diabetes Underrecognized
Teaser: Despite the increased risk for depression, anxiety, and eating disorders among diabetic patients, few clinics offer even basic mental-health screening with     diabetes treatment.

Headlines: Sleep Deprivation Mimics Psychosis
Teaser: After being kept awake for 24 hours, healthy, sleep-deprived individuals exhibit response deficits that are key markers of schizophrenia.

Headlines: Mislabeling Prompts Recall of Ibuprofen and Oxcarbazepine Tablets
Teaser: American Health Packaging recalls 1 lot of ibuprofen and 1 lot of oxcarbazepine in 100-count cartons distributed to US hospitals nationwide.

Headlines: African Americans With Cancer Pain More Likely to Receive Morphine
Teaser: African Americans with cancer pain are more likely than similar white patients to receive morphine, with 3- and 6-glucuronide neurotoxic metabolites that accumulate in chronic kidney disease (CKD), and less likely to receive oxycodone.

Headlines: Psychotherapy May Be Best Approach for Psychogenic Seizures
Teaser: Psychotherapy that includes cognitive behavioral therapy and targets trauma and other issues may be the best treatment for patients with psychogenic seizures.

Headlines: Steroid Epidural Injections No Benefit in Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: Epidural injection of glucocorticoids plus lidocaine offered minimal or no short-term benefit in the treatment of lumbar spinal stenosis.

Headlines: In Utero Exposure to SSRI May Up Obesity, Diabetes Risk
Teaser: New animal research suggests in utero exposure to fluoxetine may increase risk for metabolic disorders, including diabetes.

Headlines: Cryopreserved Testicle Tissue Used to Produce Baby Mice
Teaser: Scientists have for the first time produced live offspring from testicle tissue that was cryopreserved and say a similar technique might one day be used to preserve the fertility of boys facing cancer treatment.

Headlines: Largest Study to Date: Transgender Hormone Treatment Safe
Teaser: A multicenter study of more than 1500 patients receiving cross-sex hormone therapy for at least a year showed that most side effects were minor, providing     reassurance on safety.

Headlines: Inhaled Insulin: What to Tell Patients
Teaser: Get ready to answer patients' questions about Afrezza, a new inhaled-insulin product.

Headlines: Physicians Pose Barriers to Urinary Incontinence Treatment
Teaser: In focus groups, insured women with urinary incontinence cited barriers to treatment, including fear of treatment, lack of knowledge, and physician insensitivity to the problem.

Headlines: Ibrutinib in CLL: Indication Expanded, Benefit Confirmed
Teaser: The FDA has extended the use of the drug to also cover use in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) with a chromosome 17p deletion.

Headlines: Oral Hepatitis C Drugs Helping Patients Coinfected With HIV
Teaser: Results from TURQUOISE-1 and PHOTON-2 show that interferon-free regimens are achieving impressive response rates with few adverse events in patients coinfected with hep C and HIV.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes: No Delay With Low-Dose Otelixizumab
Teaser: Low-dose otelixizumab was safe but did not preserve beta-cell function in patients with newly diagnosed type 1 diabetes in a phase 3 trial; GSK has started a new dosing study.

Headlines: Botox Helps Overactive Bladder Beyond 2 Years
Teaser: In the first long-term study of Botox for overactive bladder, efficacy and safety persisted for a median of 2.4 years with no additional safety issues, report researchers.

Headlines: HDL-Raising Drugs: No Value in the Statin Era?
Teaser: In the era of widespread statin use, investigators say studies testing fibrates, niacin, and CETP inhibitors do not support raising HDL         pharmacologically to reduce clinical outcomes.

Headlines: Real-World PrEP Use Protects Against HIV
Teaser: An extension trial shows the uptake of pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is high and effective, even without daily adherence.

Headlines: Mifepristone in Cushing's Disease: Long-term Results
Teaser: Tumor progression rate lower than expected after a median 11-month treatment with the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist to control hyperglycemia,         report study authors.

Headlines: Whistleblower Case Against Celgene Can Proceed, Says Judge
Teaser: A former employee alleges that Celgene engaged in unlawful marketing of thalidomide and lenalidomide and downplayed risks before the drugs were approved to treat cancer.

Headlines: Canada OKs Aptiom as Add-On Therapy in Epilepsy
Teaser: Eslicarbazepine (Aptiom) is indicated as adjunctive therapy for partial-onset seizures associated with epilepsy in adults who do not respond adequately to conventional therapy.

Headlines: Novel Tamoxifen Gel Could Reduce Adverse Effects
Teaser: A tamoxifen gel applied directly to the breast produces antiproliferative effects similar to those produced by oral tamoxifen, but with fewer systemic effects.

Headlines: 'Mississippi Baby' Thought 'Cured' of HIV Relapses
Teaser: An infant who was seemingly cured of HIV now has detectable levels of the virus after 2 years without any evidence of the virus.

Headlines: Lung Societies Want Restrictions or Ban on e-Cigarettes
Teaser: The Forum of International Respiratory Societies has called on governments to ban or restrict use of electronic cigarettes until their health effects are better understood.

Headlines: Adverse Events Caused by a Drug Warning?
Teaser: Did the FDA's warning about suicidal behavior and antidepressant use in young people do more harm than good?

Headlines: Exciting IPF Treatment News Must Be Interpreted Cautiously
Teaser: Recent trials show the first successful treatments for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Exciting news for this fatal disease, but success rates must be interpreted with caution, says Dr. Andrew Shorr.

Headlines: Universal Lipid Screening in Kids: Benefit or Harm?
Teaser: Our panel of experts debates the merits of universal lipid screening in children 9-11 years of age.

Headlines: Naproxen CV Safety vs Ibuprofen Challenged in WHI Analysis
Teaser: Common perceptions about the CV safety of NSAIDs took a hit in a Women's Health Initiative study, but not everyone agrees with it.

Headlines: How e-Prescribing Can Land You in Court
Teaser: Most doctors are unaware that an issue in the EHR and e-prescription process can create a potential problem with patient safety. Here's what you need to look out for.

Headlines: Antipsychotics: Adverse Events That Send Patients to the ED
Teaser: Antipsychotic side effects result in a high rate of ED visits. Find out which drug is the worst offender.

Headlines: Growing Doubt on Statin Drugs: The Problem of Drug-Lifestyle Interaction
Teaser: Dr John Mandrola takes a worried look at the "irrational exuberance" over statins compared with data and reviews lifestyle intervention vs drug treatment.

Headlines: Daclatasvir (Daklinza) for Chronic Hepatitis C Cleared in EU
Teaser: The potent oral antiviral, indicated across multiple HCV genotypes and in combination with other oral drugs, yields cure rates of up to 100%, the manufacturer says.

Headlines: Retina Specialists Report Problems With Ocriplasmin
Teaser: Many patients suffer adverse effects after treatment with ocriplasmin for vitreomacular adhesion, a survey of specialists finds.

Headlines: Getting a Good Day's Sleep
Teaser: Melatonin may extend daytime sleep in night shift workers and certain stimulants may increase alertness, a new review shows.

Headlines: WHO Calls for Strict Global Regulation of e-Cigarettes
Teaser: The WHO is calling for global regulation of e-cigarettes and similar devices as public health concerns gain momentum, especially as they affect youth and nonsmokers.

Headlines: Sclerosis: Autologous Cell Transfers May Help Patients
Teaser: A new study has found that injections of adipose-derived stromal cells into the fingers of patients with systemic sclerosis decreased pain and increased function.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Acute Kidney Injury
Teaser: Use of atypical antipsychotic medications may increase the risk for acute kidney injury in elderly patients, causing researchers to call for their use in this population to be reevaluated.

Headlines: Turning the Tide Against Inappropriate Antibiotics
Teaser: We seem to be fulfilling Alexander Fleming's direst worry, but do people really think about the greater good when prescribing antibiotics?

Headlines: Do Beta-Blockers Cause Depression?
Teaser: Why, after decades of widespread use of these drugs, has it been difficult to determine whether beta-blockers indeed cause depression?

Headlines: Codeine for Kids: Glass Half Empty or Half Full?
Teaser: Despite a reduction in the prescription of codeine during pediatric ED visits, thousands of children are still given codeine for cough or URI.

Headlines: 8 Malpractice Dangers in Your EHR
Teaser: Many doctors use their electronic health records in ways that could potentially make the EHR evidence in a malpractice lawsuit, and strengthen the case against them. Here's how to be careful.

Headlines: Chemo Safety: Can Biomarkers Help?
Teaser: Dr. David Kerr reports on 'toxgnostics,' the use of genetic markers to identify patients at high risk for adverse side effects from chemotherapy and logically modify doses before treatment

Headlines: Stigma Is a Side-Effect of HIV-Prevention Medicine
Teaser: Truvada is a drug that can help people who are not infected avoid contracting the virus that causes AIDS. But some patients are worried the medical community is not up to speed.

Headlines: New-Onset Neuropathy: Case Challenge
Teaser: A patient presents with new-onset peripheral pain. What is the most likely etiology?

Headlines: New Agents Topple Resistance in NSCLC
Teaser: Dr. Mark Kris reports on new agents that overcome acquired resistance to EGFR TKIs in patients with NSCLC who have a T790 mutation, and recommends rebiopsying patients to identify who would benefit.

Headlines: Vitamin D and Mortality: Should Clinical Practice Change?
Teaser: Do two thirds of your patients need more vitamin D? Find out from Dr. Cedric Garland as he examines the relationship between vitamin D levels and mortality risk.

Headlines: Switching Antiretrovirals May Not Enhance HIV Treatment
Teaser: Changing treatment when the viral load is suppressed can increase the risk for subsequent virologic failure, new research shows.

Headlines: Dairy Saturated Fats Lower Type 2 Diabetes Risk
Teaser: In a new study, the incidence of type 2 diabetes was found to differ depending on the type of saturated fatty acid consumed. Dairy fats appeared to be     protective.

Headlines: Best Treatment for Shoulder Pain?
Teaser: Physical therapy is just as effective as corticosteroid injections in alleviating pain and disability and improving quality of life, and may be less costly.

Headlines: Self-Monitoring and Titration of Meds Drops BP in TASMIN SR
Teaser: Twelve-month findings from a small, unblinded trial offer support for a strategy of having hypertensive patients keep tabs on their own blood pressure and     adjust their drugs as needed.

Headlines: Complication Rate No Higher With DBS in Older PD Patients
Teaser: Neurologists may still be reluctant to refer older patients with Parkinson's disease for deep brain stimulation for fear of surgical complications, but a new study suggests this fear is unfounded.

Headlines: TMS Improves Memory via Brain Surface Networks
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation improves memory by targeting surface regions connected with the much deeper center of memory, the hippocampus.

Headlines: What's Going to Be Hot at ERS 2014
Teaser: First results from AMBITION, the large pulmonary arterial hypertension trial, will be presented along with the latest strategies for treating asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

Headlines: Getting Help for Postpartum Depression for Uninsured Women
Teaser: Women who lose their health insurance in the postpartum period find it hard to get mental health care for postpartum depression, new research shows.

Headlines: Wanted: 60 Volunteers to Test Ebola Vaccine in Middle England
Teaser: Fancy testing an Ebola vaccine? It may sound scary but the scientist behind the British trial of a shot that has so far only been given to monkeys sees little risk and is optimistic he will drum up enough volunteers.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: New Drug Class Outclasses ACE-I in Chronic HF
Teaser: Although observers are cautious, one expert writes hopefully that the trial "may well represent a new threshold of hope for patients with heart failure."

Headlines: COPPS-2: Colchicine Stops Postop Pericarditis, Troubles Gut
Teaser: In COPPS-2, patients taking colchicine had a high rate of adverse GI events, and this likely explains why there was no overall benefit in preventing AF     after cardiac surgery; but it was effective for pericarditis  of postpericardiotomy syndrome.

Headlines: Huge Decreases in LDL Cholesterol With Alirocumab: ODYSSEY
Teaser: Tested in high-risk CVD patients, heterozygous-FH patients, and patients intolerant to statins, treatment with alirocumab resulted in as large as a 60%     reduction in LDL cholesterol from baseline. Some patients even got down to LDLs of 50 mg/dL.

Headlines: IV Lidocaine an Option for Critical Limb Ischemia Pain
Teaser: Intravenous lidocaine proved better than IV morphine in alleviating pain due to critical limb ischemia in a randomized double-blind controlled trial conducted in Iran.

Headlines: Primary Care of Prostate Cancer Survivors
Teaser: The American Cancer Society's new guidelines outline what the primary care clinician needs to know to provide optimal care to prostate cancer patients and survivors.

Headlines: Gamma Knife Brain Surgery Promising for Severe OCD
Teaser: Gamma ventral capsulotomy, a type of ablative brain surgery, for intractable obsessive-compulsive disorder shows promise according to results from the first randomized, double-blind trial.

Headlines: Oral Sea Buckthorn Oil to Maintain Post-menopausal Vaginal Health
Teaser: Sea buckthorn oil taken orally can help improve vaginal atrophy in postmenopausal women, a new randomized trial suggests.

Headlines: Skin Reactions to Phenytoin Linked to Gene Variants
Teaser: Carriers of a genetic variant linked to reduced drug clearance have more than 10 times higher odds of developing adverse skin reactions to the antiepileptic drug, suggesting screening may flag risk.

Headlines: Obesity Drug Safety Debate Escalates in Medical Journal
Teaser: Arguments and accusations fly as physicians and others debate the FDA's wisdom in approving lorcaserin and phentermine-topiramate.

Headlines: FDA Expands Approval of Pompe Disease Drug
Teaser: On the basis of new data available since the approval of Lumizyme, the FDA has expanded approval to include patients younger than 8 years, as well as eliminating the REMS program attached to the drug.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Linked to Fewer Opioid Deaths
Teaser: A new study finds lower rates of death from accidental overdose of analgesic opioids in states where laws provide access to medical marijuana.

Headlines: Post-Beta-Blocker Flap, New CV Guidance for Non-CV Surgery
Teaser: The ESC/ESA and ACC/AHA issue new recommendations for the cardiovascular management of patients undergoing noncardiac surgery, including how to use     beta-blockers in the post-DECREASE era.

Headlines: Treatment for CLL: Change Aplenty, More Coming
Teaser: A new review looks at what clinicians should be doing right now in the management of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Antibiotic Overuse in Kids: Lessons Learned
Teaser: What are some of the reasons that antibiotics are overused in kids? Dr. Zaoutis explores lessons learned from Medscape's recent member survey.

Headlines: GARFIELD-AF Off and Running in the United States
Teaser: GARFIELD-AF coinvestigators Samuel Goldhaber and Gregory Piazza talk about US enrollment in this real-world registry of anticoagulation in atrial fibrillation.

Headlines: Ebola Therapies and Vaccines Need Priority, Support
Teaser: Editorials published this week by major infectious disease experts call for support and prioritizing development of Ebola therapies and vaccines while maintaining momentum in controlling the outbreak.

Headlines: MRSA: Experts Question the Value of Some Control Precautions
Teaser: Some European infectious disease experts have questioned the value of contact isolation and screening for controlling MRSA.

Headlines: Jury Out on Histamine-2 Receptor Antagonists for Pediatric GERD
Teaser: There is little high-quality evidence to support the efficacy and safety of histamine-2 receptor antagonists (H2RAs) for pediatric gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), researchers said.

Headlines: Glaucoma Drug Eyed as Novel Diabetes Treatment 'Archetype'
Teaser: An old glaucoma drug, methazolamide, improved glucose control in a small study, probably due to a distinct mechanism that the manufacturer, Verva, hopes to     pursue.

Headlines: The Cardiology Show From ESC 2014 with Dr Valentin Fuster
Teaser: UPDATED with Transcript // Focusing on the positive trials from ESC, including PARADIGM HF and ODYSSEY, Dr Fuster and panelists end on the sobering note of poor medication adherence.

Headlines: Have We Overlooked Palliative Care?
Teaser: Palliative care is not just for patients in hospice, explains Dr. Diane Meier; good palliative care can help relieve the suffering of people with chronic or disabling illnesses.

Headlines: Can Our Brains Handle the Information Age?
Teaser: Best-selling author and neuroscientist Daniel Levitin discusses how clinicians can manage today's constant stream of information.

Headlines: 'Not for My Child': Dealing With Vaccine-Refusing Parents
Teaser: A large number of parents refuse to vaccinate their children, despite evidence dispelling myths and supporting immunization. Here are hands-on tips for physicians dealing with these patients.

Headlines: Antidiabetes Drugs: Really New and Improved?
Teaser: How will newer agents fit into contemporary management of diabetes?

Headlines: HPV Vaccine: It's About Cancer Prevention -- Not Sex
Teaser: Teen immunizations and cancer prevention -- Paul Offit, MD, offers advice to clinicians on how to improve the woeful HPV vaccination rates in adolescents.

Headlines: Probiotics: Help or Harm in Antibiotic-Associated Diarrhea?
Teaser: 'Good bacteria' are appealing, but should we rush to recommend them to prevent antibiotic-associated diarrhea?

Headlines: Vitamin C, Tobacco, and Pregnancy
Teaser: Smoking and pregnancy don't mix, but what about adding supplemental vitamin C?

Headlines: A Rapid-Fire Review of Four Big Trials From ESC 2014
Teaser: Drs Harrington and Ohman weigh in on SIGNIFY, SOLID-TIMI 52, PARADIGM-HF, and NECTAR-HF from ESC 2014.

Headlines: Complementary and Alternative Treatments in Cancer
Teaser: Eight popular complementary interventions in cancer care are assessed on the basis of the scientific literature and what experts in the field say about their safety and effectiveness.

Headlines: Two Drugs Better Than One for Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: New data from the AMBITION trial suggest that combining ambrisentan with tadalafil cuts clinical failure in pulmonary hypertension by 50% compared with either drug alone.

Headlines: First UK Volunteer Gets GSK Ebola Vaccine in Trial
Teaser: The first volunteer in a fast-tracked British safety trial of an experimental Ebola vaccine made by GlaxoSmithKline received the injection on Wednesday, trial organizers said.

Headlines: 'Real-World' Study Shows Two Drugs Better Than One for COPD
Teaser: Patients with asthma or who  were not taking long-acting anticholinergics derived especially good benefit, investigators say.

Headlines: Empagliflozin Useful Second-Line for Diabetes vs Glimepiride
Teaser: The SGLT2 inhibitor empagliflozin provided favorable results at 2 years compared with the sulfonylurea glimepiride when used as second-line     therapy after metformin in diabetes.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Trial Finds 'No Red Flags': U.S. Senate Testimony
Teaser: A key safety trial of an experimental Ebola vaccine manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline has injected 10 healthy volunteers since Sept. 2, and so far 'no red flags' indicating serious adverse reactions have been found.

Headlines: FDA Okays Naloxegol (Movantik) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Approval comes following results of 2 studies showing the drug is safe and effective.

Headlines: ASTRO Issues More 'Don't' Recommendations
Teaser: The radiation oncology organization has a new set of 5 practices that should be stopped or only used occasionally.

Headlines: Urinary Incontinence: ACP Offers Nonsurgical Options
Teaser: A new American College of Physicians guideline suggests nonsurgical treatment options for women with urinary incontinence, including Kegel exercises, bladder training, weight loss, and exercise.

Headlines: Daclizumab in MS: More Detail on Phase 3 Results
Teaser: Full final results of the DECIDE trial show 'impressive efficacy and manageable safety,' with daclizumab HYP, the lead investigator reports.

Headlines: Vitamin D Doesn't Prevent Calcium Drop After Gastric Bypass
Teaser: Sharp decreases in calcium absorption were observed even when gastric bypass patients maintained adequate vitamin D levels, with the level of decline     correlating with the percentage of weight loss.

Headlines: FDA Okays Methylnaltrexone (Relistor) for Opioid Constipation
Teaser: The makers of Relistor announced approval of an expanded indication for this previously approved drug in treatment of opioid-induced constipation.

Headlines: Early Azithromycin in Infants Risks Pyloric Stenosis
Teaser: Infants who receive azithromycin within the first days of life have an 8-fold increase in risk of developing hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, report researchers.

Headlines: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory
Teaser: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory

Headlines: New AAN Position Statement on Opioids for Noncancer Pain
Teaser: In a new position paper, the American Academy of Neurology responds to an urgent public health problem, suggesting that for many pain conditions the risks likely outweigh the benefits.

Headlines: Scientists Grapple With Ethics in Rush to Release Ebola Vaccines
Teaser: Normally it takes years to prove a new vaccine is both safe and effective before it can be used in the field. But with hundreds of people dying a day in the worst ever outbreak of Ebola, there is no time to wait.

Headlines: 'Impressive' Duration of Response With Nivolumab in Melanoma
Teaser: Preliminary data from the first phase 3 trial with the immunotherapy nivolumab show that most patients who respond continue to respond (up to 10 months).

Headlines: EU Panel Likes 4 New Cancer Products
Teaser: The EMA's CHMP has recommended a new drug for non-small cell lung cancer and one for gastric cancer, a new drug for chemotherapy-induced neutropenia, and a new imaging product.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Naloxegol (Moventig) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: On the heels of its US approval, European regulators have recommended approval of naloxegol for opioid-induced constipation in adults who fail laxatives.

Headlines: Laquinimod in MS: Latest Safety Data 'Reassuring'
Teaser: The latest pooled data from the extension phases of the major phase 3 studies show no new adverse effects and no signal of any type of cancer.

Headlines: Metformin in Diabetes: Evidence Overwhelming, or Unclear?
Teaser: The drug is old and widely used for type 2 diabetes, but disagreement exists as to whether the data support its use; 2 experts at EASD faced off in a     lively debate.

Headlines: Diabetes Is On-Target Effect of Statins, Genetic Study Finds
Teaser: Scientists say they have found a partial explanation as to why statins might up the risk of developing diabetes and, importantly, that the diabetogenic effects may not be easily disentangled from the LDL benefits.

Headlines: Stepwise Stages Critical When Tapering Pain Meds
Teaser: Go slow, give encouragement, and consider the substantial neuroplastic changes that occur as patients break free from a pain management regimen based solely on medication, a new withdrawal approach suggests.

Headlines: Failed HCV Drug Cardiotoxic in 40% of Treated Patients
Teaser: When analyzing the 34 patients treated with BMS-986094, researchers found that 14 had some form of systolic dysfunction. Those cases of low LVEF might have     remained undetected, given that troponin and BNP levels were relatively normal.

Headlines: Long-Acting Reversible Contraceptives Best Choice for Teens
Teaser: New AAP guidelines for teenaged pregnancy prevention now recommend long-acting reversible contraceptives as first-line contraception for teenagers who are  sexually active.

Headlines: What's Hot at ESMO 2014
Teaser: New data promise to be practice changing, and will change the standard of care for melanoma, prostate, and lung cancer, among others.

Headlines: In Search for Beauty, Some Find Vision Loss
Teaser: Patients injected with subcutaneous dermal fillers may be at risk for occlusion of ocular arteries leading to transient or potentially permanent vision loss.

Headlines: Childhood Trauma Heightens Disease Risk Into Adulthood
Teaser: Exposure to family dysfunction, abuse, and neglect as children can increase risk for most of the leading causes of death in the US, a pediatrician warns. Her practice starts with routine screening.

Headlines: 'Most Powerful' Combo for Type 2 Diabetes Fulfills Promise
Teaser: The combination of a GLP-1 agonist and basal insulin produces remarkable results in type 2 diabetes, say the authors of a new meta-analysis and     accompanying comment. But cost remains a concern.

Headlines: First US Study of Mesenchymal Stem Cells in MS
Teaser: The phase 1 study established safety, and while it was not designed to look at efficacy, there were some 'enticing hints of benefit' in individual patients, the lead investigator said.

Headlines: Osteoporosis Drugs Lower Fracture Risk, but Best One Unclear
Teaser: There are very few head-to-head trials of pharmacologic treatments for osteoporosis; thus, reviewers are left to summarize trials and observational studies of individual drugs.

Headlines: UK's NICE: No to Nab-Paclitaxel for Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: The draft guidance says that the benefits of nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine in metastatic pancreatic cancer do not outweigh its high costs.

Headlines: FDA OKs Menactra as Booster Against Meningococcal Disease
Teaser: Menactra (Sanofi Pasteur) is indicated in individuals 15 to 55 years of age for booster vaccination against meningococcal disease caused by Neisseria meningitidis serogroups A, C, Y, and W-135.

Headlines: Brief Scale Linked to Antidepressant Overprescribing
Teaser: Using brief depression symptom measures, especially the PHQ-9, may lead to overdiagnosing and subsequent unnecessary prescribing unneeded antidepressants for those at low risk for the disorder.

Headlines: Question Drug Prescribing in Advanced Dementia
Teaser: More than half of nursing home residents with advanced dementia receive medications of questionable benefit, at 'substantial' personal and monetary cost, a new study shows.

Headlines: Opioid-Induced Adverse Effects Hit Social Media
Teaser: Social media analysis reveals patients are talking about constipation and other opioid-induced adverse effects, and about lack of communication with doctors.

Headlines: Statins Don't Up Diabetic Microvascular Disease Risk
Teaser: An analysis of a large database in Denmark suggests that statin use among adults who later develop diabetes does not raise the risk for microvascular     complications and may even protect against them.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Linked to Increased Alzheimer's Risk
Teaser: Use of benzodiazepines for insomnia and anxiety, especially over the long term, may increase the risk for Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: French Company Carmat Fits Second Patient With Artificial Heart
Teaser: French company Carmat said on Monday it had fitted a second patient with one of its artificial hearts and would continue clinical trials on two more patients.

Headlines: The Opioid Constipation 'Disconnect'
Teaser: Doctors and patients have differing views on the impact of opioid-induced constipation and use of laxatives to relieve this adverse effect.

Headlines: Rapid Streptococcus Tests Accurate
Teaser: A metaanalysis has suggested that rapid streptococcus tests are accurate and may not need confirmation with throat culture.

Headlines: Quadruple Dosing of Doripenem Safe in Patients With CF
Teaser: High doses of the antibiotic doripenem are safe to use in patients with cystic fibrosis suffering from acute respiratory infection, report investigators.

Headlines: FDA Okays First PD Inhibitor: Pembrolizumab for Melanoma
Teaser: The first of a new class of programmed death (PD) inhibitor drugs has been approved in the United States, much earlier than expected.

Headlines: No Bladder-Cancer Risk With Pioglitazone, Says Takeda
Teaser: Takeda has submitted new data to regulatory authorities worldwide that it says show there is no bladder-cancer risk with its diabetes drug pioglitazone.

Headlines: Alemtuzumab for MS: Encouraging 4-Year Data
Teaser: Latest data continue to show low rates of relapse and new lesions, with brain atrophy said to be slowed to 'almost normal.'  But safety issues are still a concern for some.

Headlines: K-Binder Averts Hyperkalemia Over One Month: Top-Line Results
Teaser: A phase 3 trial of the potassium sequestrant ZS-9 met its primary end point by averting recurrent hyperkalemia compared with placebo, said ZS Pharma in a     short announcement.

Headlines: Single Radiation Dose for Malignant Spinal Cord Compression
Teaser: A single but higher dose of radiation preserves mobility in patients, and is cheaper and more convenient than lower doses given over several days.

Headlines: Odanacatib Efficacy Stays Strong, Side Effects Give Pause
Teaser: Results from the phase 3 LOFT trial show robust reduction in fracture risk but small yet alarming increases in stroke; atypical fractures prompt a closer     look.

Headlines: Idelalisib (Zydelig) Approved in Europe
Teaser: The first-in-class oral agent is now approved in the EU for the treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Now a Worldwide Problem
Teaser: Consumption of synthetic cannabinoids, aka K2 or Spice, has increased all over the world - despite law enforcement and regulatory control measures, reports a new NIDA-led study.

Headlines: Probiotics Cut Autoimmunity 33% in Infants at Risk for Diabetes
Teaser: Probiotics given to infants under 3 months of age appear to reduce the incidence of islet-cell autoimmunity by one-third, according to early results from     the ongoing TEDDY trial in the United States and Europe.

Headlines: Most Vaccination-Onset Epilepsy Has Genetic, Structural Cause
Teaser: A new study shows that most seizures beginning after vaccination have an underlying genetic or structural cause, which should increase faith in vaccine safety, researchers say.

Headlines: Adjunctive ECT Effective for Drug-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Augmenting clozapine-resistant schizophrenia with electroconvulsive therapy is a safe and effective treatment option.

Headlines: Generic GA Shows Equivalence on MRI Endpoints in MS
Teaser: A generic version of the MS drug glatiramer acetate looked similar to the branded product (Copaxone) in terms of reduction in MRI lesions and side effects in the GATE study.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: Some Say, 'A New Day in Heart Failure'
Teaser: "I'm having difficulty being critical of this one," said one expert on the trial of an agent tailor-made to supplant ACE inhibitors for heart failure. But     is this just the honeymoon phase?

Headlines: Patient Expectations Largely Dictate Antidepressant Response
Teaser: Expectations about antidepressant efficacy largely dictate response to treatment in depression, as outcomes between active treatment and placebo are modest at best.

Headlines: Wide Utility of Model Predicting Troglitazone Hepatotoxicity
Teaser: What if scientists could predict adverse events of drugs in development that may not show up in animal studies or the relatively limited clinical testing     that goes on preapproval?

Headlines: TARGET 3: Rifaximin Safe to Reuse for Irritable Bowel
Teaser: Retreatment with rifaximin is safe and effective, report TARGET investigators. And long-term use of linaclotide is well tolerated.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Better Option for Kids With Fracture
Teaser: For uncomplicated pediatric fracture, ibuprofen and morphine control pain equally, but ibuprofen causes fewer adverse effects.

Headlines: Diabetic Neuropathy Pain: Mirogabalin Promising in Pilot Study
Teaser: The first serious look at mirogabalin by "top notch" investigators offers food for thought in the treatment of painful peripheral diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Long-Acting Anesthetic Effect Achieved With Neosaxitoxins
Teaser: The novel site 1 sodium channel blocker, which belongs to the class of paralytic shellfish toxins, significantly prolonged time to partial and complete recovery.

Headlines: Initial Data on 'Pharma Grade' Cannabidiol in Epilepsy
Teaser: New data suggest that extracts of marijuana are effective for treatment-resistant epilepsy but may not be the 'miracle cure' some reports have suggested.

Headlines: No Long-Term MS Risk After Vaccination
Teaser: A new study finds no association with multiple sclerosis up to 3 years following vaccination, but it did uncover a risk for demyelinating syndromes in patients under age 50 in the first few weeks after being vaccinated.

Headlines: Anti-inflammatories May Help Ease Depression
Teaser: Results of a new meta-analysis provide preliminary support for using anti-inflammatories as an adjunctive treatment for depression.

Headlines: FDA Adds Everolimus to Watch List
Teaser: Signal for possible hypertension risk leads FDA to add kidney cancer drug everolimus to watch list.

Headlines: Serious Impulse Control Disorders With Dopamine Agonists
Teaser: Researchers 'confirm and extend' evidence for the link between serious impulse control disorders, such as compulsive shopping and gambling and hypersexuality, and all 6 dopamine agonists used to treat Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Antidepressants Blunt Sexual Function, Feelings of Love
Teaser: Long-term antidepressant use is associated with significant 'emotional blunting' manifesting as sexual dysfunction in women and impaired feelings of love in men.

Headlines: Cure Rates Remain High With Fecal Transplant for C difficile
Teaser: High and sustained cure rates continue to be reported after fecal microbiota transplant for patients with recurrent, refractory C difficile, with a few exceptions.

Headlines: Does Aspirin Prevent CVD and Cancer? Ignore the Guidelines
Teaser: Ongoing trials should provide a rationale for guidelines on aspirin in primary prevention of CVD and cancer. Until then, use astute individual clinical judgment, says Dr Charles Hennekens.

Headlines: From HCV to EoE and IBD: Best of ACG 2014
Teaser: Dr David Johnson takes you on a whirlwind tour of the practice-changing highlights from this year's American College of Gastroenterology meeting.

Headlines: Up-and-Coming IOLs
Teaser: Dr Roger Steinert describes the latest presbyopia-correcting intraocular lenses expected to reach the US market soon.

Headlines: Is a Drug Causing the Hyponatremia?
Teaser: What is the reason for the new-onset hyponatremia in this older woman?

Headlines: Combating Depression With CAM
Teaser: What sort of evidence supports CAM therapies, including DHEA, saffron, and light therapy, for treating depression?

Headlines: e-Cigs: Consensus or Controversy?
Teaser: A growing number of organizations have weighed in on the pros and cons of electronic cigarettes.

Headlines: Medication Lotto: Can a Drug Cause a Gambling Addiction?
Teaser: What could be causing this older man's newfound passion for gambling?

Headlines: A Natural Remedy for Canker Sores?
Teaser: Which topical treatment works best to reduce the size, erythema, and discomfort of recurrent aphthous ulcers?

Headlines: Monoclonal Antibody Shows Promise for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: The search for a medication to prevent migraine without causing annoying adverse effects may finally be at an end. Prof Diener explains.

Headlines: Statins: The Good, the Bad, and the Unknown
Teaser: More than 200 Medscape readers weighed in on the growing doubt among clinicians about the risks and benefits of statins.

Headlines: Can We Medicate Our Way Out of the Obesity Epidemic?
Teaser: Dr Vega weighs in on old and new agents for the treatment of obesity.

Headlines: Quiz: Nobel Prize in Medicine Laureates
Teaser: Test your knowledge about the Nobel Prize in Medicine and its laureates.

Headlines: Treating Low T: Are the Benefits Worth the Risks?
Teaser: The FDA is looking more closely into the safety of approved testosterone products. In the meantime, what do we know about treating low T?

Headlines: Patients Should Be Warned of Testosterone Risks
Teaser: Dr Gerald Chodak discusses an FDA panel's recommendation to change labels on testosterone-replacement products in order to discourage their use in 'low T' cases.

Headlines: Egg-Rich Diet Not Harmful in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new Australian study explores the differences in lipid levels seen between type 2 diabetes patients randomized to a diet low in egg consumption (less     than 2 eggs per week) vs high (12 per week).

Headlines: Long Flights and Patients at Risk for Acute-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Patients with risk factors for acute-closure glaucoma may consider taking special precautions on long flights, researchers suggest.

Headlines: EU CHMP Completes Review of Ponatinib, Finalizes Warnings
Teaser: The European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has now recommended strengthening its warning for ponatinib.

Headlines: Drug Reactions Largest Factor in Fatal Anaphylaxis
Teaser: Drugs, foods, and venom accounted for most deaths from anaphylaxis.

Headlines: EMA Finds Little Evidence That Testosterone Ups CV Risk
Teaser: But the EU agency's committee still rules that labels of testosterone-containing products should be updated.

Headlines: Conference to Headline 'Remarkable Success' in GI Medicine
Teaser: Innovations in the treatment of hepatitis C will be highlighted at the meeting.

Headlines: Intravenous Ibuprofen Reduces Childhood Fever
Teaser: Previously untested in pediatric populations, an IV formulation of ibuprofen could be an effective alternative for children who can't take oral medication.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Have Secondhand Adverse Effects
Teaser: Adverse-event reports to the US Food and Drug Administration about e-cigarettes from nonusers include respiratory complaints that could be related to nicotine toxicity.

Headlines: Restrict Valproate, EMA Committee Urges
Teaser: A European Medicine Agency's committee recommends strengthening the restrictions on the use of valproate in women of childbearing age.

Headlines: Alcohol Intake Tied to Low Sperm Quality, High Testosterone
Teaser: Men who drank 40+ units of alcohol per week had 34% lower sperm concentration than those who drank 5 or fewer units.

Headlines: Significant Retinopathy Risk With Long-Term Hydroxychloroquine
Teaser: Long-term use of hydroxychloroquine may carry a significant risk of toxic retinopathy, according to a retrospective case-control study.

Headlines: Breathing and Awakening Trials Cut Ventilator Complications
Teaser: For patients in intensive care, ventilator-associated events can be avoided with spontaneous awakening and breathing trials, say researchers.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs Fund in England: Plugging a Gap in Cancer Care
Teaser: The fund provides cancer patients access to targeted agents deemed too expensive by the National Cancer of Clinical Excellence, but is it really only a temporary solution?

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Emergency Visits More Than Double
Teaser: The number of ED visits involving synthetic marijuana products has risen exponentially.

Headlines: Solution to US Cancer Care 'Crisis' Is Less Cancer Care
Teaser: There is a need to revise the disease-centric approach that requires that all cancers be treated, regardless of age, comorbidities, and likely side effects. Overall well-being should be paramount, say a pair of reformers.

Headlines: Soy Isoflavones: No Evidence of Endometrial Harm at 3 Years
